description:
Visiting the area & so far everyone's been very nice & inviting. After a long day of sight seeing all I wanted was a good burger & a beer. This place did not disappoint. The bartender was very nice, super welcoming. Greeted us as soon as we walked in. Had our drinks in front of us in less than 5 minutes. Ordered cheese burger, carnitas torta, 3 tacos, 2 fries & 1 Cajun fries for a total of $48 with 18% tip. Nice deal. And the red salsa tasted like my mom's . 
This bar also has 1 pool table, a couple of games, tv's with sports. 
Definitely would recommend!
author: Vanessa A.

description:
On my favorites places to go when I was a student at SF State. I just so happened to stop by this past week to meet up with friends and was reminded of why this was always an ideal spot to go to on Friday and Saturday nights. I was here this past Thursday and it was the best timing and day to be there. It was not crowded at all and my group had plenty of space to roam around without bumping into other patrons.

The beers on tap were only $3 as well which was awesome. I believe there were only 2 bartenders working at the time or maybe they had just switched shifts, not sure. 

The pool table was open and available as well which was nice. The other games I saw that they provide here are Jenga and a home arcade basketball game. 

As for the bathrooms.....I'll let you experience that for yourself!

Overall, a good night and good drinks. 

#ThirstyThursdays
author: Robert F.

description: Stopped in after a day around town for the happy hour deal of $3 beers. Overall great selection of beers on tap, especially the Tart Mango Cart.
author: Jenna T.

description:
Came here for the pats vs steelers game on Sunday and had a blast. Sat at the bar and the bartender, Nicki, was very attentive to all the patrons there for game night.Major props to her since she was the only bartender the entire night.  

This pub is perfect to come watch any sporting events. There's food and good drinks and there are like 8 tvs here!! There's also a pool table and a basketball arcade game. So whats not to like?!? Crowds do get rowdy during game time but that's normal for a sports bar. 

We ordered 2 beers and the garlic fries, Bill came out to be about 23 dollars...not bad for a 3 hrs stay at th3 bar. Garlic fries were good and is very big!! 

If I wasn't out of town during super bowl weekend, I'd definitely come and watch it here...maybe next year then!!
author: Caitlin P.

description: Went into Chug Pub to try out their new Mexican restaurant, Casa Barajas, and I walked out as quickly as I came in. When I came in I went to the bathroom. While I was in there I noticed one of their servers come from one of the stalls and left without washing their hands. I quickly left and will never return. Went to Nick's Tacos at Underdogs instead.
author: Lauren M.

description:
This was the go-to spot back in the college days. 

They had friendly bartenders, great drinks, and it was the the place to watch Bay Area sports especially during the World Series and Warriors season. There were never any issues whenever friends would come here. Everyone had chill vibes

They have decent nachos, a pool table, and some board games your friends can play whenever it's not too busy. 

They do have limited seating though and the bar area gets crowded easily since its a narrow corridor but the bartenders are attentive and get to you as quick as they can. 

They even have a smoking section in front with a TV so no important plays are missed.

I made great memories that I can vaguely remember at this bar.
author: John C.

description:
Beer is good, despite being a dive they do clean the tubes from the kegs. IPAs specifically lagunitas and Guinness. 

The let down is the full taco menu is not a available. Only fried stuff and they have no nachos.

Cute spot though and half the patrons are really intoxicated in a happy, non violent way. Plenty of TVs and sound system for jukebox better than expected.
author: David A.

description: Probably the cleanest & nicest pub I've been to in SF. The staff is super friendly, the drinks & the food are delicious. Would definitely come here again & recommend to a friend!
author: Mariah P.

description:
Came to Chug Pub on Saturday for a friend's birthday. Bartenders Joanna and Nikki were friendly and attentive. Pricing was very fair.

Will be back if I'm in the area again!
author: Alan H.

description: Just visited the Chub Pub because CASA BARAJAS is now serving excellent Mexican pub food there.  Great tacos, homemade chips and salsa, tortas, quesadillas, Asada Fries, Burritos and even Burgers.  The food is excellent, prices unbelievable reasonable.  You can also order take out  and there is $2.00 taco Tuesdays. Catering is also available. A real delightful surprise to find  in the Inner/Mid Sunset.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
I came here after hearing from a friend that they had Uyghur (central asian) food but was disappointed to find out that they are not serving any at least for the next few months. Decided to stay regardless and had a few drinks and some tacos (their menu has a small number of mostly Mexican options plus some random stuff like bruschetta and cheese bread). They were also out of a few menu items so the already small menu got even smaller. 

Drinks are fine- decent pours and they had a pretty good beer selection. The food was okay, nothing too special. There wasn't a lot that separated this from other bars and I'm not sure if I would come back unless I happened to be nearby or maybe if they brought back the Uyghur menu. Not bad but not particularly memorable or interesting either.
author: Seema U.

description:
"I'm getting ultimate fires at Chug Pub" is just about the sketchiest-sounding statement you could make about plans in the Sunset.

It doesn't help that Chug Pub looks dark and stormy, there is a smoking room, the crowd is not the hip twentysomethings of SoMA, and overall ambiance reminds me of Moe's from the Simpsons.

But once you get over the apparent sketchiness and appreciate it instead as divey, Chug Pub is a neat place:

(+) Decent selection of beer on tap, and happy hour is $3 select pints until 6pm. We actually got there a little after 6 and the bartender didn't notice, but she still gave us HH on our first drinks. Cocktails are hit-or-miss and somewhat inconsistent in terms of strength.

(+) Pool table and Pacman arcade games. Fee-for-service, but these games are entertaining in themselves and ridiculously amusing after a few dranks.

(+) Many TV's. The extent to which I follow sports is mostly limited to what I passively absorb on my Facebook newsfeed, but for all normal people out there who watch sports, I like how there are plenty of TV's so you don't have to turn around and sit at weird angles.

(+) The food is pretty amazing. Unlike overpriced generic burgers and fries you find at most bars (or worse, no food), Chug Pub gets creative and has used psychoanalytic optimization to concoct the best drunchies food of your imagination. 

We stopped by for drinks one night and saw some people eating what essentially looked like In-N-Out animal fries on steroids, so we made it a point to go back. The ultimate fries are indeed the ultimatum of bar food: a basket of waffle fries bigger than your face, generously slathered with cole slaw (yes, veggies!), pulled pork, bacon, BBQ sauce, jalapenos, and topped with a RUNNY fried egg and DINO CHICKEN NUGGETS. I know the exaggeration looks funny in a review, but it exactly illustrates my excitement :D Although the ingredients were mostly canned/frozen/bottled, everything together was delicious. Also, the portion was large enough to feed two hungry people for dinner (and probably more for post-prandial late-night drunchies).

(?) Parking? If you plan to chug, you should not be driving :P
author: Edna C.

description:
I've live about two blocks away from this place -- and I'm pretty glad I found it.  It's the perfect casual low key bar.  You can dress casually, just hang out, play pool or watch the game.  It's pretty chill. 

I will admit, I totally avoided it for a few months because the bar kind of looks so dark/borderline sketchy from the outside...so as a girl, I wasn't too keen on going -- but it's actually not sketchy once you actually go in.    

I actually had no idea they even had food, since I always come so late -- but I will definitely be back to give the food a try.  

Definitely worth hitting up if you're local, can't say I recommend making a trek if you are not.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Great prices on pitchers and has all the bay area sports games on! The only problem is that it is hard to find a seat when any game is on because it is a small bar.

Haven't tried the food yet, but I hear good things about the asian food here! First time seeing asian food at a sports bar haha!
author: Andrew S.

description:
Chug Pub is small looking but it's a long bar. not a lot of seats.
many flatscreens up tuned to my channels

HH: 4-6, $3 wells, beers

drips:
-lots of various hard liquor available too.
-parking is iffy in this area.
-thursday has more beer on special (stella, blue moon,..)
3..5 stars. too claustrophobic for me.
author: Victor G.

description: Grace place!  I left my bag and the staff helped in every way possible highly recommend
author: Ben S.

description: Great neighborhood bar. They used to have this weird Uighur food but thankfully they changed it to normal bar food. I love the management and all the staff. Special shout out to the bar tender Ben. He's one of the most intelligent and well rounded people I've ever met. He has traveled the world touring as a musician, is a talented athlete (golf, tennis, darts), and is an amazing cook and food critic. Tip this man well and he will reward you with legendary tales and sage wisdom. Five stars.
author: Coleman M.

description: This is a cool spot to hang out with friends. There's a pool table, a basketball hoop, good food, prices for beer are amazing, a good variety of beers on tap, the bartenders are friendly, and they play a mixture of modern and 90's hip hop. The vibe is chill and I liked that it wasn't too crowded on a Friday night.
author: Evana L.

description:
While on an accidental pub crawl we wandered into Chug Pub. There's a pool table squeezed in between the bathroom and some tables making it a little difficult to play, but still fun. 

Beers are fairly cheap and I hear they have a chug tower complete with its own tap for a table of friends during the big game. It's also been said that the chug tower comes with a free basket of fries. 

The most interesting thing about this bar is the pop-up restaurant that has taken residence in the kitchen. I'm pretty sure the kitchen is ran by a father-son team trying their hand at the whole restaurant thing. The food is Uyghurm which is the food of Chinese Muslims. You won't be able to find it anywhere else in the city. 

If you're planning on eating at Chub Pub don't expect something close to Chinese food. Uyghurm food reminds me of Indian food; playing up potatoes and plenty of spice. Three of us shared the spicy chicken, which was good. There were large slices of garlic in the dish and I kept eating them thinking they were sliced water chestnuts, so I was left with a funny aftertaste. If I wasn't drinking beer for 8 hours straight I would have enjoyed the food more. For me, I don't think Uyghurm food is te way to go on a belly full of beer.
author: Emily E.

description:
The beer selection is on point, a wide array of beers local and nation wide with a little bit of everything for everybody. The prices are solid too.

The food is pretty good. The lamb pie is mostly the delicious crush while the insides are not as delectable. The pumpkin dumplings are meh because they're kinda loosely packed which is not to my preference. I would prefer my dumplings to be stuffed to the brim or a solid chunk.

The best thing is those kebabs. Man, three sticks of cumin covered lamb was so good. The meat was a bit tougher than I expected but the flavor and grill of it is just the best.
author: Rohan D.

description:
This places photos and reviews need to be updated to reflect the awesome Uyghur Food!

Noodles with lamb  were ON POINT... the sauce was delicious and the noodles tasted hand-pulled. That dish along side beers and football and a pool table makes this an awesomely unique spot. Highly recommend.
author: Jake D.

description:
This place is fun and lively. Came here for that epic 18 inning Giants game the other day and had a good time.  

My only problem with the place is the layout.  It's long and narrow, and when it gets packed it is hard to get around.  The room in the back is spacious, but the pool table takes up a lot of space.  Drinks are average pice, about $5 a beer.  They have these beer tower things that look really cool. NOt sure how much they are, but seems more fun than getting a pitcher.  The only problem is you gotta find a table top to enjoy it at.  

With any place in the area, parking is horrendous and it can get crowded.  It was especially crowded because the Hardly Strictly Blue Grass festival let out during the game.  In some ways this lowered my star rating because a bunch of drunk, funny smelling people came in not so much to watch the game, but to continue their debauchery...annoying.  Oh not to mention it was 90 degrees that day.

All in all a pretty fun dive bar with good atmosphere, but not really a stand out.
author: Veasna H.

description: Ben was an amazing bartender. Loved the ViBeS of the place. Would definitely recommend!
author: Ashley A.

description: I went here on Saturday night & atmosphere was great, the music was good & I received the best service from Jessica. Jessica Is The Best Bartender In The Whole Wide World Craig!!! I recommend everyone go check out Chug Pub & ask for Jessica for the best service.
author: Michello O.

description: Street parking. Not a bad selection of beer on tap. Music selection is pretty good too if you like classic rock. Food is very poor quality bar food that tastes a lot like frozen food from supermarkets. There is one pool table that is a dollar per game.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Your average SF Sports Bar.

Full Bar w/ TV's and Pool Table. 

Gets a little cramped on the weekends or when there is a game on. 

Price is right and the service is good. 

I won't go out my way to come here but never disappointed when i do. 

The food looked decent though i haven't had the opportunity to try it yet.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Chug Pub is a very casual sports bar that is definitely a neighborhood hang out. I only went in for a couple of drinks with my son after the 49er vs Eagles game (49ers won!)
Chug Pub is a very full service bar with many beers on tap. Numerous   TVs scattered around to watch the game. 
We did not eat there and I really did not see anyone having a meal... So I think this is mostly a drinking joint.
The service was very good, and we will be back again! MORRY 
Enjoy... WEST-MORRY
author: Morris W.

description:
Wow I'm really stoked I found this place. When I looked for great bars in San Francisco I've realized there are certain bars for certain people, and I've found it's hard to find a great place to be yourself and enjoy the weekend! Jessica, the bartender, made my experience so much fun, actually she is the reason I actually enjoyed myself there, seriously full of energy, excitement and above all she was positive! Just the reason I come to a bar!!

Love this place would 100% recommend!!!!!!!
author: Hunter H.

description: Used to love coming here but they are very lax with cards. Someone stole mine and one bartender blamed me while one took my side. At one time they were better. Not hopeless but not fun.
author: Danny L.

description:
Seating can be a little uncomfortable but it is a bar so it wasn't that bad. 
Great drink and beer selection and good lord the chili cheese fries were suuuuper off the hook. 
Garlic fries are on the bottom and it's covered with delicious chili and cheese. 
Hands down one of the best bar apps I've had.
author: Blake R.

description: WOW! This is how I need to start this out ! And SECONDLY, I would never do this ! Never write an awful review BUT between the service and food being, I dunno, soaked, peed on, OR/AND ran underneath cold water. The entire staff was taking shots, drinking beer, and playing pool OVER serving ANYTHING PERIOD. (Not saying having a good and relaxing time during your shift shouldn't happen, it totally should) BUT you also get your job done ! Needless to say, that was so shitty all around ! I'm not some picky person or judgement, but that was one of the WORST experiences at a bar/restaurant I've ever experienced in over 20 years! I HAVE to give "one" star in order to even post this ! But it's like negative stars if that was an option !
author: Cherie B.

description:
Fun atmosphere. The perfect place to get together with friends and grab a drink. Get there early because it tends to get packed.

Definitely go for the beer tower! It's $35 and comes with either garlic fries or nachos - the perfect drunchies. :) The fries are better IMO - they're easier to eat, less messy and taste better.
author: Ava S.

description: Rowie and Linda are awesome! And so is Jose! This place is super chill. Always a great time here.
author: Elton N.

description:
Chug pub is a great local bar in the sunset for you to catch all your sports. They have plenty of TVs all around the bar, varying in size. If you feel like playing pool, they have a pool table. 

Drinks are pretty average. We got a blue moon pitcher for $18 and the beers were $5 alone. There's towers of beer that cost about $35. My friends got two towers among about 6 of us during the Giants game so it's pretty worth it to get. It does get warm as you drink though because it's just sitting there on the table so drink fast!

The shape of the bar is rectangular so there's not a ton of room but it's decent. It can get pretty packed for big games (like the playoffs) but other than that, it's a pretty chill bar.
author: Connie Y.

description:
Came here by myself on Superbowl Sunday, to watch it with a bunch of random people!

It was packed. I had a hard time making my way to the bar, but I finally did and ordered a newcastle and fish n chips. 14.75 or something close to that. I opened a tab because CC minimum is $15.

The fries were overly salty, I understand why... it's a bar and they're trying to sell alcohol. The fish was yummy. I'd recommend it. They give tartar sauce, ketchup, and they have sirracha sauce somewhere, just ask. When Q1 was ending, I was going to go to another bar (different bar for each quarter), I wanted to pay by credit card, so I ordered a PBR + Jager for 6 dollars. Drowned my sorrows, and moved to the next bar.

There's a good selection of beers and a full bar. The bartenders are fairly nice, funny, and some are attractive. 

There are a good amount of TVs around, which made this place ideal to watch the superbowl. 

Now, I've been hearing about the beer tower, which I have not gotten a chance to try, but I'm so down! I'll add another review when I return for this. Definitely coming back soon!
author: Kaje Y.

description:
I went here to for my 21st birthday with some friends and my boyfriend and we had a great time. 

The interior was typical pub fair, but what I first noticed was the Pringles dispenser near the door. Genius! The bartender was very nice and she told me a happy birthday, which I appreciated. Our group settled in the smoking room, which is a little section of room open to the side walk.  

My bf ordered the "Beer Tower" which, in my opinion, was absolutely beautiful, haha. As the night went on we had more drinks and just had a chill time.

When we arrived at the pub there was hardly anyone there (we went on a Saturday night) but after a while more people came in, even a group of guys in fake moustaches and beards! I wanted to know what the reason for the fake facial hair was (and to ask for one myself, haha) but they left before I got a chance to. Oh well.

The food was ok. I ordered a burger and fries and they weren't anything special, but my bf did say the food can be pretty good but it varies. 

What I didn't really like was that there were no toilet seat covers in the bathrooms, but nothing like setting some toilet paper down can fix.

I enjoyed Chug Pug as my first bar and I would be happy to go again.
author: Adri A.

description:
took me a while to finally write a review about this place. Cool bar play to hang out with your friends. You'll get a stamp on your hand when they check your id at the door. Few tv where you can watch any sports that are showing for the day. They only have one pool table...you have to pay to actually get the eight pool balls. It can get preoccupy on a busy day. 
Good beer. will definitely try other drinks the next time I come here
Good and tasty chicken wings.
If you come around 8 pm even on a Friday, may be less crowded. But it can get crowded if you go during playoffs for baseball or football. This place is small so it can pack fast if you go prime time
Depend what time you go, most of the time parking may be difficult but unless you get lucky to find parking around this neighborhood.
author: Julie N.

description: Roomy local bar.  Very quiet on a Friday night?  Not my normal hood of North Beach but I was expecting it to be more lively.  I'm use to the North Star where it takes 15 minutes to walk through the crowd from the front door to the bar.  But hats off to the Chug Pub for being there for the neighbors.
author: Kevin L.

description: I just moved to SF from LA. Maybe it's the geographic difference. But this is the worst I ever been to. Food is good but took them an hour. Service is ridiculously bad. Bartender thinks she's some hot crap. Enough said!
author: Sibo F.

description:
This is a place I'd driven and walked by a million times over the years.  I went in yesterday and found it to have a really cool vibe.  The beer though was poured with a little too much head.  I find that to be a prevalent issues at a lot of establishments these days.  The central asian cuisine offered as pub grub looked pretty interesting.  The bartender described it as, "it's like muslim chinese food".  I'll be back.  They had a lot college football on and the bartender was very accommodating in changing the channel for the customers.

It looked like they had some pretty good $3 happy hour deals, though that only goes from 4 to 6pm on weekdays. 

The beer tower was impressive.  I'd only seen something that looks like a 3ft bong with a tap at the end attempted in Vegas.  I was told that it contained 135 ounces.  The bartender said it equates to about 8 beers.  Not bad for $35.  The bartender said that Pizza Orgasmica also has something similar, but that they were the first in town to do it.
author: Daniel K.

description: Local, fun Sunset bar with a great rowdy crowd that has clearly just begun its drinking life. Beer towers abound and fun to boot. Just so out of the way, that unless you live nearby I can't see a reason to stick around. Definitely a good time when a sporting event is here or you're just trying to get a drink after some enjoyable packed event in Golden Gate Park.
author: Joseph L.

description:
This is my friends' newest hangout spot. I finally decided to grace my presence upon them this past weekend. Haha. =P

We got the beer tower. $30 for 3 liters of beer. Kinda pricey. But it includes a free appetizer per tower. The garlic fries and nachos are pretty good. Drawbacks about the towers: nothing to keep the beer cold and must pour verrrry slowly to avoid the head. 

$1 pool and 50 cents Marvel vs Capcom. Not a bad way to spend Saturday night! =D
author: Marti L.

description:
- 1 star for size of the bar, but this could easily be 5 stars (only bias is because I'm an LA native, and really used to spacious areas)

In other news: BEER TOWER FOR $30-35?! COMES WITH A FREE ORDER OF FRIES OR NACHOS?!

I'M SOLD. I'M DONE.
author: Jeffrey M.

description:
Hey! Lets go to Pub Chug? Ug Pub? Snug Mug? Oh. Chug Pub.

This was my first time back in years... celebrating a coworkers bday yesterday. 
As other have mentioned, this is your standard neighborhood dive but with a ton of charm. 
Walking in, youll notice a long, narrow bar with a pool table in the back.
HH is from 4-8 with $3 beers and your standard pub food ranging from $5-$12.

Our group got the wings (which had the buffalo sauce and ranch on the side), fried mushrooms, nachos with fried chicken on top (yes, you heard dat right) and the waffle fries with what seemed like cheese-wiz.
All food was standing, nothing to write home about.
$3 big daddy IPAs were notable. We also ordered a few doubles of galvatron (151, patron, makers mark) which came out to $8 which was solid seeing as on polk street it can go for +/- $20.

What warrants a review was the patrons and bartender.
All patrons are the after-work locals who are just there for a damn good time. We occupied the pool table for a while but as others waited, we all chatted up and had friendly competition amongst eachother. It was a mixed bag of people yet everyone was fun, offered us drinks and even got us a round of pool. The bartender was super nice, had heavy pours and chatted up the whole bar as if she were one of us. These neighborhood dives can be a hit or miss when it comes to service, but chug pug slammed dunked it.

All in all, solid. Will absolutely be on rotation so I can give underdogs a break. wont be my all-night-long destination but i can see myself starting here to get the momentum going. 

Come in, chug a beer, shoot some pool and have a jolly ol time.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I'm a lush that doesn't like bars (a total oxymoron); I prefer lounges instead. BUT, Chug Pub is my favorite bar in SF!

PROS:
*Strong drinks and fairly priced drinks (~$8)
*HH is 3PM - 8PM ($3 beers and $3 well cocktails)
*BOMB ASS GARLIC FRIES
*Friendly bartenders
*Chill crowd that's not too Asian (i.e. FOBs) like other Sunset neighborhood bars
*Flat screens, pool table, and video poker machines
*Enclosed outdoor patio for smoking

CON(S)
*BEWARE of the concrete mystery log right outside the front door. I've always tripped over it or fell backwards over it. *sigh*

I've only gone to Chug Pub on weeknights so I'm not sure how it's like on the weekends. But if you're having one of those "days", the $30 Chug Tower is the be all and END all of it.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Theres a reason this 'pub' is always empty and its because they try to steal your money. Even though I've been a loyal customer, I finally had enough last night when they tried to double charge me for drinks I did not have. After inquiring about it they tried to to say that 'I had one too many' and had no idea what was going on. Now, maybe it was the bar tender that night who was new, but either way I had to fight to get my money back, and that is not an accusation you should be making of your customers when you run a bar. That is not how you run a service and not how you retain a customer who has been going to your bar for over a year.
author: Don H.

description: Personally, I think the food is hit or miss, but it is nice to have the option. The drinks aren't overpriced and I've found the bartenders to be very friendly towards me. The vibe is also hit or miss--sometimes it is more crowded, sometimes it is completely empty. Haven't quite figured that part out yet, but it is a cool spot to kick back in my opinion.
author: Elise S.

description:
This is more of an FYI review since I didn't really do anything here.

I came here because another bar we were at did not carry the Pac-12 Network. We called this place and they claimed they had it. We arrived here and it turned out they didn't and they didn't have their information straight when we called. So in case you want to watch any sports, just be aware that these guys have DirecTV and are limited to whatever channels are provided through that service. And you should take what they say on the phone with a grain of salt.

Also, this place was incredibly empty at a time when other bars were packed. You can take to mean either a) they offer a quieter and roomy place for a drink, or b) they're not as good as other places.

There was one super awkward guy who was here watching a Giants game alone here, and as soon as we went to the counter he started boasting of his amazing tech and hacking skills. Not sure what that says about the clientele here.
author: Allen C.

description:
Thanks to one of my besties (whom I haven't seen in almost a year) who dragged me and Lovie out last Friday night. This was the location of our impromptu reunion.

When we walked in and saw our friends, there was something else that caught Lovie's eye: this cylinder full of beer! Oh boy, I haven't seen his eyes light up so wide since the first time he laid eyes on me ;-) Lovie was so amazed at the sight. And at 30 bucks for 7 pints of Blue Moon with an appetizer of choice, we were chug chugging the night away.

Mucho props for serving food all night at good prices. 5 bucks for a basket full of onion rings were greasy deliciousness. And those cheese and salsa fries were just as good! Boo for closing at 1:30. With the pool table, video games, TVs, and hanging out with good friends, I wanted to stay longer!

If you live in the Sunset, you have to check this place out!
author: Grace L.

description: Linda is the sexiest bartender of LIFE. I go just to watch her beautiful arms pour amazing drinks. Her long, luscious hair blows in the wind like in the movies. It can't get any better than that on a Friday night.
author: Marla M.

description:
This is one of the worse bars for a sports bar. 
1) if you want an Asian crowd, this is the place for yah! 
2) if you want an Asian crowd that caters to "buddies and friends" then work your magic and be friends w/ them. BECAUSE you'll have two Asians save seats for like half the bar for more Asians to come and it'll be all ok. 
3) there isn't even decent seating or "hang out" areas.  
4) there's window area that's opened and since there aren't a well facilitated "smoking area" the smoke will just come right in. 
5) a pitcher of beer is also very expensive, $18 and it's not even a regular full pitcher. it's like come on, really?!  with usual pitchers, you get at least five pints, but with there's you only get 4 max.
author: Catherine C.

description: Wings are pretty good. The mini mushu is excellent with spam and egg. Great neighborhood gem.
author: Anthony A.

description:
I once saw somebody fall asleep laying down on the sink counter.

Granted, it was his birthday.

Also, he was my buddy.

Also, he climbed up, after washing his hands.

Also, we might have helped him.

9/10, sink counters are sturdy
author: Ben T.

description:
+Happy hour 4pm-8pm!
- Their clock on the wall is 20-25 minutes fast in order to regulate drunks on the weekends lol
- Cash only
+In my neighborhood with great prices
+Good place to watch games or just to stop in for a quick drink
+/- Staff is friendly and inviting. Some bartenders make better drinks than others...

Conclusion: Get the beer tower and come during happy hour! I think its the latest one in the neighborhood
author: Julia D.

description:
Stopped by here with some friends who insisted on buying a few drinks before heading home. I've been wanting to grab a drink for a while so this worked out just fine for me.

Chug Pub is easy to find, but it's hard to find parking. 

The place itself is pretty spacious and nice. They have a good food/snack menu but we were all too full to try anything at the time. I also like that they have a separate room for smokers.

They had a special on PBR's and Jager shots ($6 for both) so we had a round of that. It was my friend's birthday so he got stoplight shots. I ordered an oatmeal cookie and a chocolate cake shot for myself later on. 

Although the PBR and Jager deal seems awesome, don't get it if you don't one or either of them. My friend enjoyed his stoplight shots, but the shot glasses were stacked in reverse? We were confused but he took them in reverse order anyway based on the assumption that the bartender wouldn't leave the crappiest for last....but the crappiest was definitely last. 

I tried to order an oatmeal cookie but the bartender working that night didn't know how to make it. I didn't mind that so much since I knew the recipe, but in the end she couldn't make it because they didn't have one of the ingredients. Slightly annoyed because the whole time, she was very slow about taking our order and making the drink (and it wasn't even BUSY). She let me have the incomplete shot for free though, which was cool

The chocolate cake shot she made was pretty good. I didn't think it really tasted like chocolate cake but...oh well. 

Overall, okay place. I wouldn't mind going back because it seems like a good bar.
author: Sofia R.

description:
took me about over 10 minutes to get someone to serve me... 
but if my friends want to come back, i would. just for them.
servers are very immature and played around too much. 
parking sucks... street and its by a busy street. 
residential area too.. so we have to be pretty quiet after the bar closes.
author: Jenny N.

description:
Came here to continue my night after Academy of Science Nightlife, and it was not a bad choice.  The energy here is amazing.  It is a cozy little dive bar where drinks are strongly poured and cheap.  Their wide selection of brews really impressed me since I am a beer drinker.  Bartenders are nice enough, but sometimes they get a bit busy so you might have to wait a while for your drinks.  

PROTIP:  Crowd here is primarily Asian.
author: David C.

description: DO NOT ORDER the "Big-Plate Chicken (Spicy)" otherwise known as Dapanji *unless* you know what you're getting into! This is a very authentic dish made with some ingredients not listed, like Sichuan peppercorns. In our opinion they used wayyyy too many and it completely ruined the dish. Our mouths were tingly and our lips were numb, and you cannot pick them out because they're way too small. Spicy is the wrong word - it's more vinegary/salty and tingly. Very strange sensation for a newcomer. That said, drinks were cheap, Samsa was okay, and my chow mein was delicious. Great sports bar to watch Warriors games!
author: Katie L.

description:
Strong drinks + very tasty curly fries AND garlic fries = rowdy 5's who think they're 10's with filthy fingers.

Always had a good time here, more so because of the company and not so much of this particular joint. Nonetheless, it's a nearby place for us to meet.
author: Athena L.

description: I had a buddy order a Jameson and Ginger for me. The Jameson and Ginger were both in separate cups. Really? Do you not know how to mix the 2 together? I would think you know how to mix a simple drink like that since all the other bars I've been to can do it. Then when my buddy tried to ask for the drink to be actually mixed, but he was just handed a pint beer glass.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Chug pub is a great little sports bar in the Sunset near Golden Gate Park. It's got all the games playing and their happy hour is amazing. Mostly, you can get all drafts and well drinks for $3 if you come for happy hour.  It was great because I could afford to buy a bunch of fries for my group of friends. We were able to catch the A's playoff game without feeling too cramped or overwhelmed my hardcore fans. 

The seating here is a little tight and parking is definitely tough to find. Also, if you don't like sports and just want to hang out it may be tough to talk over the speakers blasting the game. However, the service is very accommodating and the bartenders and amazingly nice and friendly. 

Otherwise, the beer towers and weekday specials are tantalizing and I'll hopefully be back to take advantage of those deals.
author: Robert T.

description:
Pretty much my FAVORITE local bar in the Sunset (although i know it's slim pickins out here, regardless, it's still a class-act joint). Anyone who kicks it at the Chug Pub has obviously fulfilled the prerequisite of just being cool. Everyone, from the attentive bartenders, management, David the cook/barback, and even the local patrons are all pretty chill and super nice! 

PROS:
Awesome happy hour: $3 beer and wells from 4-8pm
Delish pub grub: Chicken tenders, wings, and the burger I love!
Hella TVs: you're free to request the game of your choice
Bathrooms R Clean! 'Nuff said.
THE VIBE! super chill, fun-loving, generally nice crowd n staff.

CONS:
I'll have to write another review when I think of some ;)
author: Janet C.

description:
Went here after Off The Grid to get some drinks.  The prices are fair but there was an oddity.

Above the door, there's a sign that says "Extended Happy Hour - $3 from 8PM to Close".  The first round of drinks that was bought was $3, around 8:30PM.  The second round at around 9:15 was $4.

Other than that, the drinks are good, the atmosphere is awesome, and there's a pool table.
author: Wally W.

description:
The bartenders can be hit or miss here.  Their happy hour special is actually pretty good,.

My gripe is with the Manager (owner) who I had a verbal disagreement with.  He throws me out and tells me to leave.. well, as I am staying at my friends place the building over I go there... Well this is to close for comfort for this guy.  I tell him I am not in front of his business I am in front of my friends building.  He tells me he's going to call the cops.  I tell him go ahead, I am not doing anything wrong.  He starts getting confrontational with me trying to incite me.  Him and his cook.  As they are trying to shove me away.  I tell them not to touch me and and put my arms up just declaring my personal space.  Well I graze the pot bellied cook in his fat stomach.. and on no.. all of a sudden I punched him?  They call the cops.  Cops come.. they tell their really stupid story.. fake story.  Seriously, these assholes are abusing City resources using false Police Reports b/c of a disagreement with the manager.

Nothing happened of course, b/c I didn't do anything wrong.  But, calling the police under false pretense?  You should be fined or arrested for such bullshit.
author: Juan A.

description:
Drinks are cheaper then a lot of bars. They have certain beers each day for $2 that's great! There's a pool table and plenty of tvs and chairs!

Definitely a cool bar to check out. Chill enviroment! People/ staff here seems cool
author: Michelle N.

description: Everything is great about this place, but it's always so crowded. Hard to come here with a big group :/
author: Anthea W.

description:
When I walked in, the very pretty but very disinterested bartender look a little put out that she had to look away from her phone for a few moments to help me. So she...didn't. At least not for a few uncomfortable minutes that I spent drumming lightly on the bar while she smirked at her phone. I ordered a Guiness that I pretty much chugged and split.

Nothing remarkable about this place except maybe it's proximity to the park. But maybe that's the way they like their drinking in that part of town. Staid.
author: Jim Z.

description:
Service:
-Friendly/cute bartenders.
-Someone comes and cleans the tables often. YAY

Drinks:
-Chug Tower: Comes with fries or nachos. I recommend the fries over the nachos just because its better. Chug tower is a great deal and also makes you look cool.
-Shots: If I could remember everything I got here I would write a simple review on it but due to the nature of a drinking joint, I am unable to. Ask for a birthday shot on your or your friend's bday! They set it on fire! Bartender also challenges you to a game to play while you drink it.

Other:
-One pool table. Always occupied. Don't even bother.
-Great place to watch sports.
-Convenient location with lots of parking.
-Good music.

Should you stop browsing yelp and drink here?
-YEP, what are you waiting for?
author: Chris C.

description:
4 stars

TV GOOD!!
POOL TABLE GOOD!!
NACHOS GOOD!!!
CHUG TOWER GOOD!!

I need not say more but for folks that don't know let me put a lil more out there.

Good spot to watch Giants play. or anyone with group of your closest 5-25 friends, rowdiness uncouraged when your home team is losing or winning, chill spot, very open, waitresses are friendly and all smiles, you can hear beats being played from the inside sounds like a car on the outside that needs dyno installed haha, but if they were to turn down the bass and up the treble a lil you can tell the speakers would knock hahaha

fun group of characters mostly the patrons have something funny to say or yell out, it is ok to be heard here. 3ft tower of chug is a definite must try just for you or your other friends if you want to share haha, nachos are heavy and filing, tvs all over the bar and pool area. definitely a chill spot for local team games.

food **** only tried the nachos I would come back for more
price $ beers on tap if not 3 foot chug tower is a plus
service **** friendly waitresses
ambiance **** open, spacious, friendly, rowdy, chill, with beats bumping making the walls vibrate hahaha
author: Clarence A.

description:
-1 star for floors being covered in gross food that people had dropped, napkins, and dirty bathrooms. Like completly disgusting
-1 star for the three bartenders spending more time with their friends who were there than serving customers (there was maybe 30 people total in the place)
-1 star for overserving multiple customers. Granted people should stop drinking on their own but when a guy is falling over or sleeping at the bar they should not serve him more beers and shots. We saw several such people and a couple of the guys were really bad off and the bouncer did nothing. I am sorry but the drunk guy trying to grope patrons and unbuttoning his pants in the bar is YOUR responsiblity to take out.
-1 star for being bitches about serving me water. I am the bloody DD sorry for living!

Only redeeming part of this place was it was somewhere for us to sit down and the food actually wasn't bad. I don't care how this comes off but I honestly felt that because i was with a group of white people we wre ignored. They weren't over burdened they were simply too busy doing shots with their friends. Sucks for the owner of this place as I repeatedly heard one of the female bar tenders tell her friends "you dont have to pay this is on me." as she poured multiple rounds of shots out. Maybe if they had been less drunk they would have served us a littler better.
author: Meg N.

description:
for the sake of not having this review removed i'll just say, RUDE unattractive bartenders

Also quoting Gianna's review:  "However, the only thing I did notice was there wasn't a large.....racial diversity. My friend & I were the only ethnically different ones at this particular pub (at least the entire night when we were there!) and normally that wouldn't be a problem but I definitely felt a little out of place at the end of the night as I felt like we got a few looks as though people felt we didn't "belong".....its mostly a hangout for Asian ppl
author: Sang L.

description:
This review has nothing to do with Chug Pub as a pub or venue.  It has nothing to do with the decor.  It has nothing to do with the bar prices, the food or even the service.  

Why?  

Because every time I try to go to the Chug Pub, the place is always CLOSED!!!!  

You would think that as a "sports bar", you would be open (even if it means outside your normal hours) for major sporting events.  Alas, the answer for this establishment is no.
author: Brett L.

description:
Been here twice with some friends and watched the Olympics here a few days ago. Both times I've gone, the place has been pretty packed, but the bartenders are pretty friendly and usually get your order in fairly quickly. The place has a typical pub feel to it - loud music (basically stuff you hear on 94.9 or 99.7 which I found amusing), lots of conversations going on, and people having a good time (some a bit more and crazier than others - it got a bit rowdy a few times throughout the night). From what my friends and I have seen, it seems like the crowd is a bit older, but if you're looking for a place to get some drinks and watch a game, this place will do just fine. In terms of transportation, the bar is only a block from the 28 and 29 bus lines and there's street parking along Irving or on 20th - might be tricky but you'll probably just have to park on Irving if it's past 8 PM or so.

As for the drinks, the Beer Tower is pretty ridiculous I gotta say, but is definitely a fun way to share a couple of drinks with friends. There's a decent number of beers on tap and basically you can choose any option so the Beer Tower is a pretty good deal - basically came out to be $35 for 3 L of beer and a basket of tasty fries for all you who usually have the drunchies. All in all, a decent place to spend a night out with some friends.
author: Cheston W.

description:
I hardly ever review pubs...why? Because I hardly ever go to them these days....

My friends visited from Portland and wanted me to show them SF. We did so by bus and BART from the East Bay.... n proud of it! Walking all day around the hills and crossing through GG Park left one member more parched than the others (the male member!)...

We found this cute, charming pub during their HH and he enjoyed the set while we chatted. The pear cider was really, really excellent and the selection of beers on tap was plentiful. From a female perspective, I think the place is really charming! Affordable pub-going....

Would stop again for a pint any day....
author: Jana C.

description:
Wha???? Why??? Why do people love this place so much? From the time we reached to front door to the the time we left I never felt safe. I'm not sure why but the uneasiness never subsided. (Props to the gal that complimented by scarf in the bathroom!) 

The boys love this place because of the "Beer Tower." For $30 you get approximately 8 beers in a crazy tower-with-spout contraption. The boys timed their "team chug races..." $60 gone and 10 minutes later- DONE. Really?

The bartender was friendly, and I enjoyed picking music off the jukebox...but nothing about this place would make me venture back.
author: Annalise F.

description:
Tons of Beer and the Beer Tower with make you an official alcoholic in no time!

Cute Bartender make waiting to order a pleasure.
author: Mario A.

description:
I love everything about this bar. Location, food, drinks, bartenders, atmosphere, the people!

Parking can be a headache to find sometimes but a little walking does a body good anyways.
There is usually parking a block down on Irving, or in the parking lot but the only place I don't want to park in front of is a bar.

Great alcohol selection, they have the good stuff that other bars don't usually have.
Must I mention their BEER TOWERS!? Perfect for a group, and you can get whatever beer you want!
It also comes with a free side (nachos, fries)

Shots are huge by the way... Huge meaning like a double shot. I always walk away from this bar drunk, or close to drunk.

Pool tables, TV's, huge tables for big groups, JUKEBOX?!! This bar is just plain awesome.

Sometimes I even come if I can't drink just for their garlic fries, which are so addicting.
I'm still dying to try they're samosas, my friend always rants about them but they're never serving it when I go. :(
author: Jenny Y.

description:
i like coming here with my friends on nights when we want to chill and not go HAM. I didn't see anyone mention this below me, but there are also (dusty) board games behind the bar. they've got battleship, chess, jenga, or connect four! factor in a beer tower and garlic fries and you've got yourself some ridiculously competitive drinking games. just a note though, jenga pieces are not the biz when you knock the stack over and have to pick up all the pieces off a grimy bar floor...

the pool table is also pretty legit. however, it's $1 per game so you'd best be at least somewhat of a pool player and not aiming to just hit balls around for fun. i've also had some problems when the balls aren't released and get stuck somewhere on the way down after you insert the money. no bigs... just stick the cue up into the hole where the balls are and wiggle it around a bit  (get your minds out of the gutter this is the only way I could describe it!) and get your game on! 

other than that, i prefer chug pub for board games, alcohol and just a good night out with friends. I wouldn't recommend this place if you're coming to watch sports games, because the watching area is not very large. the only way you could get a prime viewing seat is if you're sitting at the bar itself.

last note - credit/debit cards have a $15 minimum! sooo either get your drank on, or remember to bring some cash!
author: Caitlin C.

description: My first time at a bar! The food was pretty good. The service seemed to be meh. They have a pool table and couple of tables where you can play Pac Man which I thought was pretty nifty. Friends got me AMF, Gummy Shot and a Fireball. Excellent fun! Might come again (:
author: Rochelle R.

description:
Stopped by Chug Pub after dinner one evening with some friends. It had an Irish pub feel and was fairly spacious with adequate seating. Also equipped with a pool table and an old school arcade video game. I never knew about beer towers until I witnessed them here! 

$30 per tower of beer (approx 7 pints) and came with fries or nachos...score! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rPwB56EQ9JfEo2mN24fqOQ?select=9JFFMAklyYHz54C46XpaIA) The garlic fries were pretty addicting but the nachos were just alright. Not the best deal for your money in terms of the beer but it was still a fun experience. The owner/workers were polite when kicking us out at the end of the night too. haha Even gave us bottles of water for free!

Great hangout spot for a chill night in the city!
author: Karen Y.

description: I pass by this place everyday and finally went to try it out for the first time this weekend- INCREDIBLE. Seriously a wonderful bar! My boyfriend and I went to watch the Patriots game around 2ish on a Saturday. It was pretty empty at first but within an hour it filled out but never got too crazy crowded. There are a million TVs which was perfect. We sat at the bar and got a pitcher of Blue Moon which I think was $16. We also got an order of the Ultimate Fries which took bar/pub food to an entirely new and unbelievably awesome level. Get those fries, you will not regret it! Also, my boyfriend ordered a coke as well which was comped when we got our bill- so great. We really had such a great time and we'll be back for sure!
author: Rachel M.

description:
Great little bar right by Golden Gate Park around 19th Ave. It's most known for their tower. A tall cylinder of your choice of beer to pour at your discretion. There is about 7 or 8 pints in a tower and its about $30. It comes with your choice of nachos or fries, which is clutch when you get the hunger pangs from drinking.

Get the Tower!!

Aside from the tower, its got a bunch of tvs, a pool table, and some tables to sit at. Great place to hang out. The bartenders are always super friendly. I come here to watch sports a lot and their really good about changing the channels on their many tvs to whatever you ask. They also, have food, but you probably don't want to order any of it. It doesn't taste too bad. They have hot dogs and hamburgers and stuff and their pretty salty and the prices are a little steep. Happy hour is good here. $3 for most draft beers and I think Amstel is $2 if you want to drink that. 

There is a outdoor room in the back where you can smoke, which is nice. The bar gets crowded sometimes on the weekends. Friendly environment and great service. Go get a beer here.
author: Arthur C.

description: So i am totally here w/my friends after i told them how awesome it is to get a tower of beer & complimentary nachos (or fries) for your drunchies! Well we paid the usual fee for our tower + tip & received no complimentary item! Turns out they serve food now so you still have to pay the same amount for the tower & thats all you get :( kinda sucks to know that youre not getting the same service when paying the same amount as before. So for everyone out there, the beer tower is sold alone, you get nothing extra! :/
author: Jeanette L.

description:
This is definitely a cool little hangout spot and I can definitely tell it is a spot where a lot of locals hangout on a regular basis. I came here on a Thursday night after going to another event, showed up around 10:15PM and it was pretty busy with a lot of people just sitting hanging out or playing pool. It's a small little place but it does have a homey vibe to it.

The drink prices here weren't too unreasonable. We had two shots of Patron, Cranberry&Vodka, and 2 Coors Lights for $27.50. That's definitely a lot more reasonable than many other bars I've been to around the city and even other bars in Downtown San Jose so I couldn't complain. The bartender I encountered was really friendly. She made a decent drink, she smiled at us, helped us right away, made the drinks quickly, etc. We didn't have any problems with the service. In fact, when we went to close our tab i felt bad for her because she was the only bartender and was busting her butt helping everyone super efficiently and you could tell she felt bad once she had noticed us and couldn't help us right away.

I can't comment on the food here because I didn't try it, but I did notice a lot of people eating and the food did look good. However, the only thing I did notice was there wasn't a large.....racial diversity. My friend & I were the only ethnically different ones at this particular pub (at least the entire night when we were there!) and normally that wouldn't be a problem but I definitely felt a little out of place at the end of the night as I felt like we got a few looks as though people felt we didn't "belong."

If I was in the area I would definitely come back here and get the Beer Tower if I was with a group of people or just grab a quick drink otherwise.
author: Gianna D.

description:
$3 beers and well drinks during happy hour. 

$30 for a ginormously large tower of a beer 

Enjoying the company of good friends over good beer at a decent price while inebriated....PRICELESS.
author: May D.

description: The food was OK. The bartender was kind of low energy and came off kind of not caring. I asked if they had potato skins and my reply was basically "no look at the menu."
author: Zachary H.

description:
THE GIANTS WIN THE WORLD SERIES!!!!!!!!!!!!

That's the memory I associate most with Chug Pub. I was sitting at the bar shoulder to shoulder in black and orange watching as the Giants won it all. People started chanting, drinks were spilling and the bartenders took out champagne bottles to spray on all the patrons. The party continued all night with the celebration spilling out into the street . 

They specialize in the giant tower which is probably good for 3 or 4 people and comes with an appetizer to munch on. Don't even bother with anything other than the garlic fries. 

Pretty much all locals on the weekends and they all seem to know each other. Unless going to meet up a lot of people you know or watch some epic hometown sports team kick ass, this might not be the best place to chill.
author: Dennis L.

description:
SAY WHATTTTTT? CHUG PUB!!

sounds deadly doesn't it.  After a nice dinner in the city, we decided to hit up Chug Pub.  It was our first time and we found this place through Yelp ( for the 100th time).   Honestly, I didn't even know a bar existed on Lincoln Way, BUT, when we mentioned Chug Pub to our friends later on, many have seemed to have heard about it.   We were able to find street parking a block away.  We walked over and find this place dead :( Well, we expected.  

There were only a large party of 5 -6, 2 parties of 2, and there was us, a party of 3.  Nevertheless, the atmosphere was very chill.  Loud oldies were playing throughout the bar.  Flat screen TVs were on some sports channel.  There were also a pool table available.  Being on a Sunday night, there was only one young lady at the bar counter serving the rest.  

We ordered a pitcher of Blue Moon (almost always) for like $14? Sat and sip on our beer as we enjoy little chats.  The other parties were also doing the same, no one was really trying to get hammered on a Sunday night. haha. My boyfriend and our friend decided to order a Ghost rider for the first time.  The bartender was really nice and friendly and explained what it was made up of and how they should take it.  If you don't know what a Ghost Rider is, it's basically a drink mixed with 5-7 different kinds of hard alcohol in a whiskey glass, lighted on fire, and you chug it through a straw.  According to my boyfriend, it gets quite hot as you get to the bottom of finishing the shot.  

We want to try their beer tower next time we go.  It's suppose to come with fries!  Happy hour is from 3-8pm with $3 well drinks! I am hoping to move Chug Pub to 4 stars :)
author: Stephy L.

description:
Came here to watch my gf do her league night for bar pool
overall nice bar, very laid back, very safe neighborhood
do drunk idiots when i came except for one guy who was from the opposing team.
great lay out, tv's everywhere.
bartenders seem nice
parking is usually not a problem, that is if you're willing to walk like 1 block and park somewhere on irving

i personally dont drink because i am allergic but i wouldnt mind coming here to hang out with friends if they wanted to get a couple of beers
author: Andi I.

description:
Place is still great. I come here less often now due to me not living in the city anymore, but when I have a chance I make sure I drop by. Even though my face isn't recognized all the time when I come back, I still get great service. In fact, a few days ago I went in early hours so my friend could try out the place. We had a limited time frame due to us having a schedule of things to do that day so the place was empty when we came. Either way the new bartender, Rowie, still treated us with a lot of respect. Gave a good image of this place to my friend before he flew back to LA. Thanks Rowie and I hope to see you again when I drop by for the super bowl. 

P.S. She gave me candy so if you read this Rowie I expect some candy again next time, haha.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
I have been here multiple times, and I have come to the conclusion that I am not the biggest fan of this place. I related a lot to Brian L's review because to a much lesser degree, I also had a bad experience with the bartenders playing favoritism and ignoring me for some reason I can't explain.

The last time I was here, I felt like I was disrespected. There were two bartenders that were WAY more concerned about flirting with some ugly drunk boys than they were about taking my order for drinks for my friends. What made matters worse was the person I presumed to be the manager at the time had to signal TWO times for one of the girls to come over to me. The first time, the one bartender who was not busy didn't look over at me, but instead rolled her eyes and told the guys she was only wanted to help them. Then on the second attempt the manager literally tapped her on the shoulder and pointed his finger at me, and the she walked over with a pouted look on her face. Sorry chica, but your taste in boys suck, and I wanted my pre-birthday celebration drink.

Then she took her time (about 10 minutes or so) to make the worst margaritas and whiskey sours I have ever had in my life. Not all Whiskey Sours are perfect, but how does one screw up a Margarita?

This place is good for groups, so most likely if I ever had friends that wanted to come here, I would still tag along because I like my friends, not because I like this place. I would just have to strategically plan out which one of us in the group has the best chances of winning the affections of the bartenders so we all don't end up with crappy drinks that take forever to make.
author: Megan D.

description:
The Chug Pub is where it's at after other bars close early. My friends and I are here whenever we have a late night. Staff is always friendly and fun. Drinks aren't overpriced and food is decent. No cover charge, but make sure you have your ID. This is one of the few bars that always has a doorman checking ID's, at least all the times I've gone.
This place is a smaller bar but still has a fun jukebox, pool, and some lounging areas. The nice part of it being smaller is that even though it may get crowded, everyone is there having a good time and I've never run into any trouble.
If you're looking for a fun atmosphere with friends, come here. You will have fun whether you're looking to start drinking, already been drinking, or just plain sloshed.
author: Chris L.

description:
The first time I went to Chug Pub was because my roommate used to go there before I moved in with her. I decided to try it out because we only live 2 blocks from it, out of the few times I've been there Alex has been there most of the times and she is super friendly and pretty damn hilarious. I'm a 3 drink kinda girl where I just don't know what is good and I'm not about to buy a drink if I won't like it, and she listed drinks that sounded amazing. Next time I go I'm having her make me a mojito. She makes a mean long island though, props to you girl.

I plan on only going when Alex is working because she made it such a fun experience, and even with one of her coworkers who I could tell English wasn't his first language she was totally nice and laugh-y with him and not berating him like a lot of bartenders I've seen do. I'll be in soon for happy hour with Alex!
author: Hal C.

description:
The other reviews already name it's best features-- good prices, cute bartenders, good food.

Environment-- is just okay! Not a place I would come alone or expect people to be friendly. Meet with friends, play some pool, drink cheap drinks! No racial profiling, but crowd is predominantly Asian (I am Asian), although it's become more diverse as of late... :)

Be weary, try your best not to get wasted here.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Did I wait too long to write this review? Maybe because I'm too busy coming here. ;)

I love Chug Pub!!! Such a great hangout spot to watch the games and hang with your friends. $3 all beer during happy hour on weekdays (till 8pm) and $6 well drinks. Or you can do $6 PRB specials all night loooooong.

All the food taste great here. I especially love the chicken tenders and fries. And onion rings, and nachos, and curly fries... and......... YOU GET THE POINT.

Great staff, atmosphere, music, full bar and variety of draft/bottled beers.
author: Nancy N.

description: I like this bar, you know why? because of the cool Pringles vending machine they have haha, look at my photo, so cool. Nah, not only that they have a great variety of beers and ciders also a TV on every freakin wall spot if you want to watch a sports game. I also tried my 1st Snake bite, Guiness floated on top of pear cider, weird. The only weird experience I had was a girl telling me she was pooping and her stall door was wide open then she proceeded to read a poem off the wall to me while I was in the other stall peeing..ummm awkward!
author: Karen T.

description:
We made the trek (okay, more like a quick taxi ride) to the Outer Sunset for my cousins birthday celebration.

This was my first time at Chug Pub and upon ordering at the bar, I could completely see why so many people love this place - the beer tower! I was really tempted to order it and share with the boy and his roommate but decided it was probably not a good idea, haha. Maybe next time!

Chug Pub is on the smaller side but there is plenty of seating, flat screen tv's perfect to watch a game, and a pool table in the back. It's definitely a more casual, neighborhood bar perfect for a chill kinda night with some friends.

I don't know if I'd make the trek out there again, but if I'm ever in the area I would definitely come back!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
In my opinion, any bar with a 3.5 liter tower of beer for 30 bucks is deserving of 5 stars simply for its ingenuity, creativity, and room for more. Chug pub screams out for a good time. happy hours go from 3-8PM, 3 dollar beers and 3 dollar well-drinks, unbeatable anywhere else.

The BEST item on the menu is the garlic fries. Hands down, no contest, BEST GARLIC FRIES in town. trust me when i say: grab a blue moon and a basket of fries, turn on the game, and the time of your life can then begin. I'd bring all my friends. There is also a pool table in the back, darts, and lots of seating where you can get shitfaced. 

I will definitely bring my strongest friends here to challenge them to a chug off for the beer tower.. but i'll have to see when.

-wifive-
author: simon k.

description: I want to like this place because I live nearby, but they don't have a great beer selection. Even worse, their patrons are constantly puking on the sidewalk outside. If a week goes by without any puke, maybe I'll up it a star rating.
author: Kerry S.

description: I was a little weirded out by the door guy/bouncer in the fancy suit who gave us a hard time about coming in at 5:30 p.m. when the place was not crowded.  Mister, this is the Sunset, not some swanky nightclub.   We waited for 15 minutes for the bartender to take our drink order (again, not crowded in there) and when she didn't we gave up and left.  So why the two stars? I love the idea of getting a gimormous tube of beer to share and there was a friendly group who offered me a beer from their tube while I was waiting.  So at least the crowd is nice and the tube of beer looked tasty.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Small.  But a great bar! Bar box pool table that is not lop sided (yes i shoot pool) good selection or beer on tap.  Good bar food.  recommend the Waffle fries and many tv's to watch your sports!
author: Steven M.

description:
I love this place! I never come here without buying a tower! If you don't know what that is GTFO cause you don't belong.

J/k it's a tall cylinder of alcohol poured out from a spout. $30 for any beer u want, and  you get either fries or nachos with the purchase. Drinks for usually 10 people. So that is a steal! 

The bar back and the bouncer knows me and my friends cause we go so often!

The only thing I dislike is the small table area. If your sitting on the outside and people are playing pool, you have to watch out for them.
author: Brendan L.

description: Maybe its me and I don't enjoy Pubs/Dive Bars. Pretty small, dirty, and grungy looking. The tables near the pool table smelt like puke, (after wiping them down with a dirty towel - that probably did wipe puke earlier on.) I kept my purse on my lap the entire time. I couldn't wait to leave. Why?!?!?
author: Tiffany M.

description: Great neighborhood bar!  It's the perfect place for friends to meet, whether sitting at the bar or at a cocktail table.  It was definitely busy on a Friday night, but we didn't have problems finding a table and seats or ordering drinks.  What more can you ask for?
author: Audrey C.

description: Last day of a vacation taking me through Vegas and San Francisco. Usually a huge Vegas fan but lost a ton of money and got an insanely intense head cold early. Came to San Francisco late in the vacation and stopped here. It has been the absolute highlight and the bartender Alex has been amazing. If I didn't live 3000 miles away, I'd be back here next weekend.
author: Kevin C.

description: Great happy hour! Not a fan of the smoking section, sometimes the smell filters through the window. Gross! Food is decent, I recommend the Double D's and the tacos. Bathroom is barely decent. Servers have always been nice. Great chill place to hang out and watch your game with a friend or two.
author: Jennifer W.

description: This place should get more stars considering the sorry state of the sunset bar scene. This place is solid little bar - though the juke box gets a bit loud for conversation .... if you're into that sort of thing
author: Oleg H.

description: Came here on a Saturday afternoon after playing drunk kickball in golden gate park and had a decent experience. The beer and food was affordable, and the wings and waffle fries were amazing. The only downside was that I noticed a slight lingering puke smell throughout the place and the bartender was hard to get ahold of. If not for that I would have given 4 stars!
author: Lauren R.

description:
Tower of beer? Good beer and good friends will result in a good time.

This is a pretty chill place, the crowd seemed to be pretty friendly, gets packed pretty quick but you can't pretty expect too much moving space in a bar right? Definitely would come back here
author: Chris T.

description:
After spending a couple hours walking around Haight Street and checking out the Conservatory of Flowers, my friends and I headed over to meet up with some other friends for happy hour. 

I saw some good reviews on Chug Pub via Yelp, so I suggested that we all meet there. Not a hole in the wall nor a fancy schmancy kind of bar, Chug Pub is a good balance of both. The kind of bar you want to meet up with friends after a long day of work and just hang out (kind of like MacLaren's Bar in How I Met Your Mother). 

For you fellow beer lovers, you'll love this place simply for their beer towers. When I walked in, I saw this ginormous tower sitting between two of my guy friends. If I remember correctly, I believe he said for $30, you get the tower and two appetizers (don't mark my words though). Score!  If that's just too much beer for you, then go during happy hour - $3 beers!  Plus, if you walk further back into the bar, there are some typical bar games (billiards, pool, arcade games, etc.) 

The service there is pretty good too.  While I was ordering a round of Irish car bombs for my friends, one of my gfs said that she doesn't like Irish car bombs.  So, I asked the bartender if there were any other bombs she'd recommend.  She suggested a Cherry bomb ( I don't remember what's in it, sorry).  Apparently it was pretty tasty because my friend tried ordering it again the next night when we were at a lounge.

Clean, local, chill, and good service from the friendly bartenders. Definitely coming back again!
author: Vicki T.

description:
No ulterior motive here folks... just had a genuinely bad night there. I can't understand how all of you guys just can't believe that. I have been to Chug Pub before, and while it wasn't the best time ever I had no problems (which I clearly said in my first review) and I even remember getting rowdy there when we won the World Series but St. Patrick's Day left more to be desired. It really seemed like everything that could go bad, went bad. 

@ Alex S... how else am I supposed to explain why I gave 1 star and had a bad night without giving a thorough explanation? I guess I could have shortened it up, called everyone ugly a$$holes and tell the girls who work there to get boob jobs like you would do.  

I'm happy that you all love Chug Pub and that you guys get the best service ever. Pat yourself on the back for supporting your bartender and have a drink for me. Thanks for telling me not to come back to Chug Pub, Alex S. because I was really looking forward to going back until you told me not to.
author: Brian L.

description:
A great place with great prices that I wish I could make my local pub, unfortunately I live in SoMa and not the Sunset. Here's the lowdown.

- Pints are always less than $5 (I got their house blonde ale and a Wyder's for $8.75.)
- On Tuesdays, their Pyramid blonde ale is on promotion for $2/pint.
- On Wednesdays, their Chug Tower is only $25 and it comes with nachos (though I haven't had it yet, just relaying the info.)
- The place looks like it used to be an Irish pub but is now owned by a bunch of asian people, which gives a weird vibe.. but how can you complain with those prices?

If you live in my neck of the woods just take the 71 from Market - drops you off right in front.
author: Josh K.

description:
I just love chug pub for some reason. 

They have a special sometimes: PBR and Jager for 6 bucks. Good stuff.

always fun.
author: Ross K.

description:
This is your typical local bar located in the Sunset District. Full of asians but that's expected because of their location. I really like the chill atmosphere here. I usually run into old friends or classmates here on Fridays and Saturdays. 

There's a pool table on the right side and the bar with some seating on the left side. It's not a very large place so it's always crowded. The bartenders are so so sweet and nice. My friend knows them quite well since he's a regular so they were very generous on drinks. 

They also have this huge beer tower that you can share with your friends.

A nice, chill place to catch up with friends and have a good time.
author: Vikki K.

description:
It's been brought to my attention that most of my reviews make me seem like a big drunky lush whore. I wish I could say this review would buck that trend, but alas, it does not. Oh well. If it walks like a duck, and talks like a duck, I guess I enjoy vodka. 

This place is legit. $4 vodka and club soda's, which means I can get relatively trashed for about $16. 

It's also close enough to my house that I don't have to worry about navigating the bus system while intoxicated. Another big plus. 

Nothing bad to say. Cute neighborhood hang out with a pool table, and sexy Asian bartenders for you boys. Enjoy.
author: Jillian M.

description: Overall a pretty decent place to get a drink and hangout with some friends. Pretty good beer selection. Nice staff with lots of TVs which makes for a good place to come watch the game. My one complaint is that the damn pool table is squeezed at one end of the pub and it made it hard to play without waiving the end of your cue in someone's face with the possibility of knocking over their drink. Someone was clearing not thinking while arranging the back gaming area. But other than that I'd come back for a quick beer after work.
author: Kaila H.

description:
1) Don't judge me for going to Chug Pub on a Tuesday night.  I like avoiding massive crowds from time to time.

2) Don't judge me for ordering the biggest beer for the cheapest dollar on the menu.  We're in a recession!

3) The bartenders are friendly and seem to check up on us whenever our glasses looked nearly empty (how do they know?!).

4) The bathroom is clean.  I mean, actually clean.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Denied at Underdogs for the World Series... I swear you had to camp out the night before to grab a seat. I was bounced around like a pinball in there, so I shot out and walked on down to Chug Pub.

No seats available here either. But I managed to find decent standing room spots to watch three of the games. They have tvs all around the bar so you can't miss a single pitch.

The bar had a great mix crowd of guys and gals and all Giants fans baby! Everybody was rocking on each pitch. Spirits were high and the drinks were flowing. The Giants winning helped a lot too.
author: Sam T.

description:
Went here to watch a Giants game since Underdogs was packed. I was surprised this place wasn't crowded at all. Our group thought it wasn't too bad and decided to stay and watch the game. Bad idea. Not only was service extremely slow, but the red-headed bartender was extremely rude. 

We managed to find a table and sit down after the previous customers finished and left all their glasses and plates. A friend goes up and places an order for drinks and food and then comes back and we wait for a good bit. When the food and drinks finally arrive, we thank the bartender, and I'm about to ask if she can take the old glasses and plates away when she rudely interrupts me and says "I'm not a waitress, you need to order at the bar." I was surprised, not only did she not wait for my question, she wasn't very good at reading minds either. So who's supposed to take these dirty cups and dishes? I guess they're supposed to walk themselves to the sink.

After 45 mins of the dirty cups and dishes just sitting at our table, we decide to just move them on to the pool table thinking they would surely get picked up there. Wrong. The cups and dishes sat there for another half-hour.

We place more orders at the bar, wait a bit, and get our stuff again from the red headed bartender. I try to let her know that the dirty cups and plates are sitting on the pool table, and she rudely says without me even getting the opportunity to say anything, "I'M NOT A WAITRESS, YOU NEED TO ORDER AT THE BAR!" Listen, if you aren't very people oriented and you can't provide decent customer service, you shouldn't be working at a bar. First time I've been to this bar since it became Chug Pub, and I'm positive it was the last time. Watch out for that red-headed bartender, she's got a extremely bad attitude.
author: Johnny T.

description:
Looking for a place to watch your local SF Giants?! Well Chug pub is the place to be! Everyone here is a Giants fan! From the customers, the bouncers, the awesome bartender girls and even the cooks! The moment you walk in, you know you're in the home of Giants fans. At first glance in each direction there's flat screens everywhere for you to enjoy the game at any location in the bar. 

The thing to order is the infamous Beer Towers! 2.5 liters of whatever they have on tap. My friends and I ordered Stella;  and each tower is just $30 and each comes with your choice of fries or nachos! We ordered 2 towers, so we got  to try the fries and nachos. Personally I felt the fries had an interesting taste; not sure what it was, but they went really well with our beer! As for the nachos we ordered them with cheese on the side to avoid soggy chips, but didn't realize they came with salsa, so inevitably they became soggy; however, those salsa chips dipped in cheese were really good!

The only downside to Chug pub is that it can get really busy so you have to get there early to get a seated or standing table; however, Chug pub knows how to keep their giants fans happy so when it does get full they're willing to check your IDs and let you watch the game from outside where you can perch your drinks on the window sill and still get a good view of the game! Overall, great place to watch the game and hang out with your friends and fellow Giants fans!

Tip: once you get your Beer tower, you get to keep it as long as you keep ordering more, but be careful if you go during a busy time you may not get one because they only have six, so first come first serve; sucks when people order them and leave them at the .25 liter mark just to keep the tower though.
author: Jon K.

description: Came here yesterday. The crowd was weird but the bloody Mary was amazing. Also the smoking room was nice Cuz u just hang out there and avoid the weird crowd.  Nice breeze and bloody Mary is all I could ask for . Oh and good company. L
author: Heather K.

description: Cool enough place, usually packed with dorky SF State students getting the beer tower. They serve food which is actually pretty good. I came here once on my friend's 21st birthday and they gave her a complementary shot of tequila, rum and whiskey mixed together that they lit on fire.
