They have a cool enclosed semi-outdoor smoking area with a window that you can walk up to at the bar where you order drinks/food. Drinks are cheap and bartenders are friendly.
author: Kelsey L.

description:
3 stars for a decent ambience. It can get really crowded and doesn't provide much of a seating area, but everyone there's generally friendly so you can call it a friendly bunch.

Separate pool table area with a few couches, nice for people that just want to chill.

LOVE the GIGANTIC menu, I never thought I'd see the day when JUST drinks would fill up a menu the size of Elephant Bar's dinner menu (try the Shambourd Sour!! thank you to my boy's boy Alden for introducing me to the favorite =)

anyways, I'll always look forward to coming here because it's diverse, and if you know ALOT OF SF(sunset) PPL, i'm very sure you will have a very nice reunion one of your days coming here. =)
author: Cora K.

description: Good bar for a quick drink. Didn't really like the creepy fool eating nasty Chinese food and sharing it with the cute bartender. That really didn't sit to well with me idk why. Not gonna say anything more because Id rather not say nothing at all then say something bad about this place, you kinda know what you're gonna get at a dive bar in this part of town, but at least everyone is friendly.
author: Mark C.

description:
i first came to this bar during a mini high-school "reunion" .  I was excited to see what this place was all about since it's one of the more popping places in this area.  It was fun only because it was fun seeing everyone, but atmosphere wise, it was too bright.  

One thing they do have is a beer tower, which I can totally see why so many guys like to come here.  I only come here on random nights when we're in the area and the guys just want to drink.  Otherwise, I've been to better bars.
author: Nancy S.

description: Best wings. Games on hella tvs. 4 player Pac man. Awesome hot bartender Genesys. I LOVE THIS BAR!
author: Regina E.

description:
Came here a few times with my friends. This place is pretty relaxing, with TV's throughout the place. The drinks here are good, and at a decent price. I've only tried the fried shrimp here since they ran out of calamari, and it was good. I mean, I could buy the same shrimp from costco, but it was still good, went well with my beer. I haven't tried the long yard cup thing that they offer yet, but it does look good when I see other people with it, so I'll probably try that next time when I go there.

Usually if you go there before 10pm, you can choose where to sit. After that, more people start to arrive and it can get pretty crowded where people that you don't even know are basically standing right next to you.

Great place to go to hang out with some friends though.
author: Johnson S.

description: This is a great local bar. I felt like i was living an episode of cheers every time i went here. Chill people and cool bartenders. Occasionally you get your college ragers, but its overall a local bar. With the addition of bar food this place is a good to bar. The tuna melt taste really good. I dont expect much, but this is something that i would pay for a sandwich spot.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Somehow when we're out of ideas on where to go on a friday night, we end up at the chug pub. And for some other reason, when we leave, we come out of underdogs a block up. weird huh? like a teleportation device.

beer towers are magical! and it comes with fries or nachos.
author: kim w.

description:
I like the Chug Pub. A lot.

Great happy hour: $3 beers. They also have the Chug Tower which is roughly 3.5 liters of beer that includes your choice of nachos or fries for $30. What more can you ask for!!
There is plenty of seating, many TV's, a pool table and the bathrooms are clean. They also have Erotic Babe Hunt which always makes for a great time. I'm happy to have the Chug Pub in my life.

It's a great bar with great beer in a great location and a very friendly staff. Check it out.
author: Denise S.

description:
When my friends and I need a place to just chill, we always go to the Chug Pub. Right away, we find a place to sit (sometimes it's hard to find a seat because most of the time, there're a lot of people...maybe because we go on busy days. haha). When you go to the Chug Pub, most def, you get a tower. If you don't know what a tower is, it's a tall cylinder filled with beer (of your choice) poured out from a spout. It cost $30 but if you get it, you can get free fries or nachos (get the garlic fries because they're that good). When I'm not drinking beer, I'll go for something fruity like a "sex on the beach". They fruity drinks are good. My mouth isn't being attacked with alcohol (haha). The drinks are fairly priced and the bartenders are friendly. 

They have flat screen tvs if you need something to look at, a pool table, and a video game machine. Another plus, for those who smoke, they have an enclosed outdoor patio. I thought that was nice so you don't have to go outside in the cold to smoke, you can sit, smoke, and chat. 

I would recommend going here. I always have a good, chill time.
author: Presh G.

description: Chug towers, ghost riders, and great bartenders!  What more do you need?  This is my go to spot on Fridays. Cool vibe, feels like home. Also a great place to catch the games with fellow fans and friendly faces.  Do yourself a favor and stop by.
author: D N.

description:
Fun and chill hangout place with a small group of friends...

I came here on a Friday night and my friend had a table at the very back of the bar where the pool table is. Many of the people there were drinking their beer towers, but my friend had a bottle of grey goose, which I was actually surprised they had! Before going in there, I thought they would only be serving a variety of beer, but their bar has pretty much anything you want! 

There are also a few TV's by the bar for those who enjoy watching sports.

We had some chicken strips and fries that were seasoned very well...so yummy!

3.5 stars!
author: Wendy T.

description:
I was here for Giants World Series on a Sunday and definitely you're typical bar in the sunset.  Beer bong towers are you're best value if you're a beer drinker and choice of nachos or fries. Went with Nachos and was unappetizing for me. 

It's a cool bar that sometimes brings in a mix crowd but most of the times I've been there it's predominantly asian...which is the norm for any bar in the avenues.
author: robert c.

description:
Chug Pub is the first bar I've been to, therefore it has a slight good bias from me! ;D Truthfully though, now that I've been to several bars, I can review it properly, and I still have it among my favs.

The bartenders here are friendly, and if you go enough they make an effort to remember your name. The ambiance of the place is positive, and the people here are just great. I never had a bad time with my friends here. Chug Pub also has a pool table. 

The only reason it lost a star was because I'm also use to having bars with dance floors ;D
author: Austin N.

description: Chug Pub was never as crowded as the pictures people posted up the times I was there.  The place isn't that big, but there's a pool table taking up a big percentage of the space.  This has to be where all of the asian people go to drink because i know they're not in the Fillmore or downtown san francisco.  I like this place because I brought one of my friends here and the bar tender looked up a recipe for a drink that I told her about that she didn't know how to make.  I can't say this place is super clean because which bar is unless you'er willing to pay way more for drinks which I'm not.  If you're in the sunset area, give this place a try!
author: Steven S.

description:
I went in for some food that Peter was making for the expanded menu on Wednesday, Thursday and Friday nights starting at 6 PM. 

His food is really good! The garlic noodles, the spring rolls, everything he makes is delicious. I like the pear cider ale it is really tasty. It has a subtle green apple tart flavor. And, most important for me it is not too sweet. The pear cider ale washes down well with the all grub food that is served.
author: Jonathan F.

description: Went there last Saturday. The service was poor and the food was not tasty at all. Plus, the prices were exorbitant. The chug tower and the pool table are not good. Overall, a really bad experience
author: Himanshu J.

description:
I walked in yesterday at opening time (4pm) and had the whole bar to myself. It was Tuesday and so all beers were $3, and Amstel Light was $2. I was happy I decided to just wander on it; $2 Amstel always tastes better when it's a drink special.

The bartender gal was super nice and very attentive; what a sweetheart!
I had two drinks and had been there for about an hour and a half or so with only one other person in there besides the bartender and I. She was so apologetic for it being so dead and told me that I'd have to come back later in the evenings to get the full experience. I laughed and told her I'd definitely be back for more...just later in the evenings.

It wasn't busy at 4pm, so if you are looking to catch up on some reading/homework (as I did) I'd suggest Chug Pub. Yes, I do plan on visiting another day, but I'll go around 8pm instead of opening time.
author: Angie P.

description:
As a drinking establishment, I'll give this place 4 stars. It's prominent exterior doesn't really quite match its quaint and modest interior. However, the inside is pretty classy (and dive-y at the same time) and I really appreciate the dark wood interior and numerous flat screen televisions adorning the walls. Not enough credit goes to places that make sure their tables aren't wobbly. I have to say the tables are stable! The staff is friendly and inviting, the beer selection is decent, and the cocktails are pretty good.

However, I can't really recommend the food here. While it's adequate, I didn't appreciate paying $9.00 for a cheeseburger (albeit being nicely constructed and with seemingly fresh produce in it) that's obviously made with a frozen patty. Tried the fried calamari as well and am pretty sure those were of the frozen variety as well (When they're uniformly shaped and look like onion rings, I'm pretty sure I'm right). Props though for coming out piping hot.

It's worth a shot for drinks and catching sporting events, but it's probably better to catch some other nearby food options within walking distance.
author: Jeffrey J.

description:
The Chub Pub - aka The Dubliner - aka Lincoln Tavern - aka The Mucky Duck, aka Chug Pub.  This place has more aliases than Method Man from Wu-Tang.   Some of Meth's more famous aliases were Johnny Blaze, Methtical, Ticallion Stallion, etc.  

Anyways, what makes the Chug Pub version wayyy better than the previous places is their Chug Tower. Damm, for 30 bucks you can get this huge 3foot high bong looking beer dispenser that you can fill with any beer on tap. Of course had to get the Hoegaarden on tap but with Guiness, Stella, Big Daddy, and Newcastle being other options you can't really go wrong.   

++++  PLUS, the Chug Tower comes WITH pace picante/canned cheese /jalapeno nachos.
author: Earl G.

description:
CHUG PUB is THE place to be at to watch your SF giants play ball! The atmosphere is great with all the loyal fans and massive amounts of drinking going on with the beer towers there. All the bartenders and people who work there are all decked out in their giants gear and that just makes it even better. Wherever you turn in the bar, there is a tv screen showing your SF giants own the Rangers!

Each tower of beer (beer of your choice, we got Stella) is $30 and comes with an order of fries or nachos. Get the fries...much more satisfying with beer. The nachos were good too - we asked for them with cheese on the side, but there was so much salsa that the chips got soggy after a while.

Though this place can get crowded, it is MUCH better than getting squished at Underdogs down the street! 

This time my friend got there a little before the game started and was able to snag a standing table near the entrance, so it was all good. 

Bathrooms are clean and the staff is great!
author: Julia K.

description: Chug pug is legit!  Thursday nights are always cracking with a young crowd.  The first time i came here I got the the tower of beer and shared it with 3 other friends.  The tower is unique, affordable, and comes with FREE fries!  I came here last Thursday and got a couple of pints of haywire for $3!  What a bargin!  Definitely a instant favorite.
author: Dean W.

description: My favorite bar when it comes to SF. The staff here are super nice and know how to make their drinks! The crowd that walks in are always usually friendly and diverse. Parking is super easy cause down the street is a small car park. The food does take some time to come out, but its okay, just sit down or play a round of billiards! For bar food, I think everything was pretty yummy! Mmmm.. unhealthy fried food and beer? Nothing gets better than this! Everything is reasonably priced and oh chug pub's beer tower is always a treat! Oh and the ladies room is actually really clean for a bar! I was super impressed! Thanks Chug Pub for so many (un)forgettable nights!
author: Crystal V.

description: This is a nice chill bar to hang out and grab a couple of drinks. The bartenders are friendly. The drinks are strong. Sports are on the set. There's a pool table to play for drinks and the music is sexy. A very down and relaxing place to get a nice buzz.
author: Anji W.

description:
Great place but can get pretty pack some nights.

I love this place and their beer towers.  It comes either with fries or nachos, I always get it with the fries since the nachos always gets too soggy.

They also have a pretty big menu of food, all you have to do is ask for it.  

The service is pretty good, can't be ask for more from such a busy place with only two bartenders.
author: Mimi P.

description: It's a shame the food is here is great because the people working at the chug pub get drunk and serve you like shit. I hope Adam from Adams grub gets his food in a more respectful establishment. But although the food is great sometimes they serve you something that is terrible as if the cook was drunk. Oh wait they were because I had trouble ordering another drink from the bartender who was busy taking shots with the entire staff. Cooks, Bouncers, Bartenders, and everyone else serving you will be drunk. I understand having some fun but this was terrible.
author: Noah K.

description: Just recently discovered this place after a long walk through golden gate park and I loved it! Secret gem for watching Giants games and had great service.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Been here plenty of times (esp for Monday night football) and not once has there been a fight.  

Love the bar food ;) anything from Cheese burgers to their nacho/fries.. YUM

the one con i can think of is parking can be diff esp during a crazy Giant's game and when people are eating dinners on Irving st.
author: Anna W.

description: Love this place.  Great beer and yummy greasy bar food.    Highly recommend as a good neighborhood watering hole
author: Charles D.

description:
came here for a friends birthday and it was a blast. i came late though and as punishment made me take the ghost rider shot/drink thingy ma jigger.. if anyone can please tell me what is in it. I'm not asking because i liked it but because that is the most disgusting drink of my life but it loosened me up and was feeling it in no time. 

atmosphere: great atmosphere not really all that dirty as far as brewpubs go. they have a pool table to keep you active. a few television sets, an online jukebox and an arcade racing game that seemed older than me but was still fun to play.  its not too loud the bartenders that night were really nice even the bus boy was funny and seemed like he loved his job. 

drinks: the ghost rider and 3 or 4 blue moons did the trick for me.

overall: i had a great time and so did the birthday boy. we even bumped in to a friend we haven't seen in about 4 years and it was great to see him. good music good drinks fun people. definitely a great place to hang out n have a drink or two just don't get the ghost rider.
author: Carl T.

description:
Hey Chug Pub I'm really digging your Special (PBR & shot of Jaeger) although my liver isn't.  It gets me messed up on a budget!  Good for you, because then I'm more prone to ordering more booze and food!  Speaking of food, I love yours.  It comes out of your kitchen hot as hell - which is almost dangerous because I don't really realize how hot it is until it's going down my throat giving me 3rd degree burns because I'm boozed up on your Special's - and you season your fries!  

Get some more guys to come in here though because last time I was here it was a taco fest.
author: Rachelle P.

description:
I came on a special day. It was after Bay to Breakers. My friends and I were limping along Lincoln and I was trying to stifle the cranky monster that would've emerged at any moment due to hunger if it wasn't for Chug Pub. 

After a couple of sips of beer and a massive burger, fries and just being able to sit down. My friends were safe from experiencing the wrath of my inner monster. 

The burger was amazingly pretty good (I'm not saying this cause I was on the bring of my definition of starvation). I think this is the best burger I have ever had at a pub! I saw a couple other runners order nachos that looked pretty delicious. The over all atmosphere is pretty pub-like. I can imagine it getting pretty crowded at night since they prices for drinks and food was pretty manageable.
author: Amy W.

description:
Hmm, torn about this review because I just had a BAD experience here, but have been here a couple of times before and liked the place. My fiance turned 30 and I forced him to pick a bar so we can all get drunk on his behalf. He's been to Chug and liked it each time, so we told all our friend to go there this past Friday night. 

I called and see if it was okay for me to drop off 2 cakes prior to the event. No problem. The bartender was really nice and helped me put the cake away in their fridge. I came back at 8p with the posse and we all had a grand ol' time shooting pool and drinking. Spending major $$ since we had about 40 people there. That was about 2/3 of the bar basically. 

Cake time came and I went into their kitchen to set up the candles and whatnot. The Asian guy in the BLACK shirt was VERY nice. He was very accomodating while we waited for all our friends to gather at the bar so I can bring out the cake. I asked "Is it ok for us to be behind the bar to take some pics of him blowing out the candles?". He said "Sure, that's fine". Great! 

So, there was me, and two other girls behind the bar. Yes, we were behind the bar a little, but just towards the end since the bar was packed with all our friends. THEN, Terrance comes out all in a huff and startes yelling "CLEAR THIS AREA! YOU CANT BE HERE"! He was trying to get out from behind the bar, so we were trying to let him out, but he was an ASS. TOTALLY yelling at us 3 girls who were behind the bar for a reason, not to just block his way! AND, how long will it take for us to sing Happy Birthday. The crowd will disperse right after.

So, he keeps shouting at us to move and we finally managed to let him get by. Then he goes "Who are these kids anyway?!" UM, first of all, these "kids" are ensuring that you get your next paycheck. Second, these "kids" are the same age as you! Just because we look younger! Last, there's no reason to be rude to your customers. There are other ways to handle a situation like that, especially if you're a "manager". 

Terrance totally ruined our experience there with his bad attitude. Thank goodness my fiance was too drunk to let it ruin his birthday celebration. Funny thing is, our friends there are actually his friends too! I spoke to a few of them since I know they go there enough to tell me who the guy was in the pink shirt. They're like "That's Terrance. He's my age". Which means MY age too, DUH! Kids my ass. What kind of manager would say that about his customers in front of all their faces. 

I think I may just end up here again since my friends frequent here. I've had good experiences here before, but what happened on Friday night just blew that all out of the water. I'd love to hear back from Chug! Maybe they can buy me a few rounds too!
author: Freckles H.

description:
Can you find a cooler neighborhood bar?

The chug tower is a hit and the place is packed on the weekends.

Nice mixed crowd, cute bar tenders, and awsome drinks.

Great little hangout with the friends and they have a smoking area for the smokers.
author: Curt L.

description: When I walked in... I felt out of place. But then again there were mainly asians.. So we sat down and decided what to drink. Jager on tap?! hahaha how sick is that. Perfect for the birthday girl. Had a few shots of hen, jager bombs and a few cocktails. Prices were average and the bartender definitely hooked up the birthday folks. Overall had a pretty decent time at the chug pub. Might be back soon, it is in the neighborhood after all.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Mainly an asian crowd here usually, well it is in the Sunset so it is expected.

It can get pretty crowed in here especially in the bar area since it's so close to the tables and stools on the side. Bartenders are cute but so hard to get a hold of to get a drink, especially if there are "usuals" or friends that are there, but I dont mind. They still put up good service and make some pretty good drinks there. Not too expensive either.

Ordered a red dragon once, girl said "i dont make these here but I will for you". I'm use to ordering them in SJ so I had no idea. At least she still made them for me, I just felt bad that my friends kept ordering them after haha. 

Food: pretty good too. So if you're here to chill and grab a couple drinks after dinner, this is a good place. Parking sucks a bit though.
author: Kenny L.

description:
I am terrible at pool but last night just seemed like a good night to play.  Unfortunately, there was a tournament going on which lasted the entire length of my visit.  What also got me in a bad mood was watching, yet again, another failed game from my LA Clippers and then getting told to go back home to SoCal by some "local" whom I suspected wasn't from NorCal at all.

Besides that, they have a pretty good selection of beer on tap and in the bottle.  I had a Honeymoon last night and it was perfect.  The bar also put out some cheese balls.  Any place giving me fatty foods with my beer is a win.  The music stemmed from an iPod since the jukebox was down.  The bartenders listened when I practically yelled, "Please change this" when 'Barbie Girl' came on.  Everyone thought it but no one said it.

It was a lovely night out for a Wednesday.  Too bad for the tournament or else it would have been 5 stars.
author: Ashley I.

description:
Twas a Halloween night...

FINALLY decided to come all to Chug Pub after how long people have been urging me to come here. 

Most people were dressed up for the occasion. The guy checking ID's in front was in a Heineken get up. The stones up front make the place really stand out. Love the look of the place inside and out. Decently clean too.  

It's decently small on the inside. Was expecting a little bigger, but pictures I've seen are deceiving.

The bar itself was not really big as expected since the place wasn't huge. Bartender was really great actually. :) She would always remember who came to the bar first and last so there was no dirty looks for anyone. Drinks were served decently quick too even though we were ordering almost 10 drinks at a time. Car bombs, shots, raging bulls, etc. 

Drinks: Not bad. They seemed a little light for some reason? Maybe it was because I had a decently filling meal, but after a car bomb and a kamikaze I felt nothing. I'm a light weight.... I admit it, but this didn't phase me. Also, for some reason, the car bomb, after it was dropped in it started to curdle up really fast. That I've never seen work that fast before. By the time I downed it, it already turned gross on the bottom. Maybe the beer wasn't cold enough? Decently cheap by the way. :)

Food: There was a girl sitting next to us at the bar, whatever she ordered smelled amazing. Must try next time :)

Restroom: I usually don't ever talk about the restroom much, but because I made two trips....why not? It was actually pretty clean for a bar. I could hear the girl that was drunk next to me stumbling around but that was hilarious. 

I would rate that we all had a pretty good time here. Drinks were a bit on the light side but I definitely will come back to do the 3 L beer :D
author: Stephanie M.

description:
I came here a couple weeks ago. Always a good time when you run into friends here! Owners and the staff are super friendly here and the drinks are very reasonably priced! Whats great about this place is that they also serve some fried-up goodies! Perfect for those like me who have munchies when they drink! 

They have games like dice and a pool table for those who just want to kick it and chill out at a bar. Great location too, plenty of parking around. Def. the atmosphere of the place is what makes it great! Everyone's friendly!
author: Betty S.

description:
One of my favorite kick it spots with my friends! $30 gets you a 3 Liter tower of blue moon & french fries (free)...what more can a girl ask for :) 
I also recommend their guava mojito if you are into the sweet girl drinks! BEST MOJITO EVER!!
author: Annie L.

description:
I live in LA and wanted to find a sports bar to watch the Laker game, so I looked up some reviews and found this place.

When I first arrived, I wasn't too impressed because the bar looked a little cramped and they didn't have too many TVs

But my attitude about the place took a total 180 because I figured out that it wasn't about the physical bar that made it so appealing, it was the locals! My party had a total blast at this bar! The locals are so friendly and vibrant...totally different from the LA bar scene.

It was fun jawing back and forth with the locals (why are you guys so anti-LA???) Anyways, it was a great place to hang out and can understand why it has so many good reviews!

For a party of 4 with a ton of food and beer/margaritas, this place is VERY Reasonable!

Would definitely come back the next I'm up in SF!!! BTW, to the bartender - LAKERS Rule!!!!
author: Don T.

description:
I grew up watching the show Cheers and I must admit once you step foot inside there's definitely someone you know there.

They're also known for their infamous beer tower.  Gosh, $30 for any beer of your selection (new castle, guinness, fat tire, etc.), which is definitely a steal.

I don't drink beer, but they have a pretty hefty selection of tequilas, especially a 1945 don julio.  I'm ready with my salt and  lime.

Always good times here.

CHUG PUB, you definitely had me at "hello". ;)
author: Sophia S.

description:
Wow, I haven't written a review for Chug Pub yet? I'm definitely lagging. 
I usually go to chug pub on Wednesdays, Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays and sometimes Mondays or Tuesdays. So.... I have been there every day of the week. Interesting. Do I have a problem? No, not really! Chug Pub is JUST that great. 

The prices for the drinks are spectacular and are definitely affordable. $6 Kettle One Tonics. Three Kettle One Tonics for under $20?! Definitely Chug Pub. The bartenders are extremely friendly and are hands down some of the nicest ones that greet you with a great smile.  

On Mondays... 50 cent wings! Get them they're delicious and well worth it. Also, there are beer towers and daily draft deals. 

Overall, great selection of beers, cheap drinks, good food, great bartenders. I love Chug Pub.
author: Tony W.

description:
Chug Pub might just be my new favorite pub/dive bar in the Sunset! Went for a friends birthday with 7 others and those who have been there before instinctively went for the Chug Tower aka huge tower of beer! It's amazing--Hefeweizen for 8.5 for only $30, and it comes with nachos or fries!   We opted for garlic fries x 2 and the nachos. I don't know if it was because I was 1) hungry and 2) feeling my alcohol from my pre-game shots, but both were DELISH--garlic fries were well salted and not overly garlicky and nachos were with very processed nacho cheese, salsa and jalapenos.  Generous portions and hit the spot. 

The venue is reasonably clean, fair amount of seating in the front near the bar as well as in the back near the pool table, and bartenders are nice. Right before closing, they gave us a countdown on how many minutes we had left to drink up. And then as we're almost out the door, he hears it's our friends birthday, and offers him a birthday shot. (Too bad my friend was too gone to partake.) 

Wasn't so busy on a Saturday night, but made it perfect for our larger group as we dominated the entire back area. I'm certain I'll make it out there again. Not too many places that have towers of beer in the city, let alone minutes away from where I and most of my friends dwell.
author: Marie B.

description:
Couple friends and I came here last night (my first time!) to check out the beer tower. There was only one bartender the whole night and she was very nice. A lot of foam fills up the top of the tower so she gave us some more in a pitcher. The beer tower comes with a free order of fries or nachos ($30)  I love fries! especially FREE FRIES! Being a Wednesday night with work the next day, we were only going to just get one beer tower and chill. That did not happen... 

We started with just one beer tower and grab couple seats in the back, filled up each cup (the tower is about 7-8 cups of beer) and started playing drinking games with cards.  Started as a nice drinking game but slowly it got more intense and it became 3 girls vs 3 boys in the end. One tower became two, two became three! With the other towers we also got nachos and then curly fries.  The nachos were loaded! Lots of cheese and jalapeno.  I liked the regular garlicy fries better than the curly ones.

It's a decent size for a pub.  Full bar in the front of the pub with a couple high tops and regular tables and chairs in the back.  There a lot of TVs around the place, a pool table, and an old school street fighter machine with a change machine as well.  The bathrooms are also pretty clean.  Despite how much I'm hating being here at work right now, I had A LOT of fun last night.  I'll definitely come back to Chug Pub!
author: Katherine C.

description:
This place is cool. 

Spacious.

1 pool table.

Juke box.

arcade machine.

Cigarette dispenser.

Drinks are expensive as usual.

Mainly an Asian bar.

Women from you group will get hit on if they are attractive.
author: Keit K.

description:
I've met some interesting people here, with some turning out to be room-mates of friends. Small world!

The bartenders are above-average while the drinks strong and averagely priced. I like the little smoking area (of which I have no more use for!) and the game area is kinda nice.
author: J H.

description: I'm not really a bar girl, but I came here one night with a bunch of friends to chill on a Monday and it's a decent spot to just chill. We got the beer tower amongst 4 people so it's 2 glasses each in that entire thing. I had a good buzz. Shots are decently priced too and the beer tower comes with fries.
author: Diane L.

description:
This is one of my boyfriends neighborhood bars.  We typically come here during the early part of happy hour.  

The bartenders have always been super friendly and attentive.  On several occasions they have made some awesome recommendations.  I came here shortly after it opened, the mojito was suggested, and it was delicious.  Another time came here for pre-birthday dinner drinks and my bf recieved a free shot of bourbon.  Awesome!!  

Since we tend to come early, there is never a problem finding a seat at the bar.  There are multiple screens displaying some game or sports news, music is ok...not too loud.  Easy to carry a conversation.

I've only tried their food once, and it was typical bar food.  We ordered the fries and calamari.  Nothing too special about either, but (in my opinion) the greasiness goes great with beer.
author: Lesliegh H.

description: Best bar in the sunset!! Janine (bartender at Chug Pub) is awesome! she doesn't mind making me a Bloody Mary at 6ish pm, and her Bloody Mary is to die for! so0o good! good bar food, happy hour until 8pm, pool table, i mean what more can you ask for! Stop by and pull up a stool and quench your thirst with a beer.
author: Lily S.

description:
Went in for the first time yesterday and met the bartender Candice, who made me her signature shot - Orgasim! 

Let me just say it rocked! It was ohhh soo delicioso! =)

Everyone was friendly and the service was great. The bar was really clean, and everywhere you look there was a flat screen! I loved the 80's rock playing in the background! 

Check it out for yourself you won't be disappointed!
author: Jesica M.

description:
I came here last night for my friend's birthday.  I live 5 blocks away and drive by every day, but I've never gone in.  Its a cozy little neighborhood bar.  You see the bar right when you walk in, and there's a back room with a pool table and juke box.  

They have lots of beer on tap, and some yummy pear cider.  They even had Hangar One and Grey Goose.  Hangar One & Tonic, please!  Yum!  They have this Chug Tower which they fill with beer.  I saw alot of people order it, but I think I would've burst if I tried to drink that much beer.  The bartenders were pretty quick.  The bar was packed, but I never had to wait that long to order a drink.  

The only complaint I had was that the place was small.  Our birthday group was around 20-30 people throughout the night.  And then add on all the other local people, and you get a very crowded and hot bar.  Its not too bad unless you mind people rubbing up on your butt as they're walking by.

I wouldn't mind coming back to grab a drink when its less crowded.  The drinks are decently priced, and I can just stumble home after.
author: Patra I.

description:
Coming here is like coming to a bigass lowell high school reunion.

thumbs up on the guava mojitos.
author: Will T.

description: BOTH times i went had a beer tower and jeggggaAAAA bombS!!! great location friendly people.. except the crowd i brought in.. my friend ended up getting arrested.. but chug pub was awsome!!!
author: Mykol A.

description:
This is my first review on Yelp lol.

Anyhow, I've been to this place a couple of times already and wanted to get a feel of it before I gave my own opinon. I went during the week and it wasn't so crowded....ok it wasn't crowded at all and it was great. Bartenders were great and funny as well. When I went during the weekend it was crazy packed. Still I got the same great service as when I went during the middle of the week. No complaints from me =). I would definitely recommend this place if you want a chill place and to stay local (yet I am not a local, but like to check out different bars wherever I'm in).
author: Jewelz P.

description:
With a name like Chug Pub, there's not much room for mystery.  You chug, at a pub.  Voilà.

The environment here is your classic sports bar, complete with a pool table, liters of beer, TVs, and killer bar food.  Though the place can get pretty rowdy, it's to be expected when a fight or a game is on.

The garlic fries were awesome, as were the nachos.  What I love about the nachos here is that it's what you would get at any baseball game, except it's littered with jalapenos.  There were literally enough jalapenos to put at least one on each chip, which, to me, is brilliant.  I can't count the number of times I've had to ask for extra jalapenos only one-fifth of the way through a plate of nachos.

The beer selection here is the same lineup of drafts you would see at any other rowdy bar in the city.  The Stella Artois on draft was, however, unexpected.

The music could be a little bit more consistent, but I guess that's what happens when you let the public take control of the jukebox.

All in all, Chug Pub is a great place to get your game on.

GET:  Beer, Nachos
author: Michael K.

description: Finally spent some time here when my friend was bartending, and it was super fun. We got there around 4pm on a Saturday and so the "regulars" were there, including a old English guy who is a little nuts but very lovably nuts. We played pool with him while he gave us some advice on love and life. They play sports games so it's a good place to chill and watch whatever game you want (there was soccer and baseball). This is definitely a casual, neighborhood bar but you get some interesting folks who stumble upon this place.
author: Shayna S.

description:
This place is great, but it has two great things going for them! 

First, Alex (The bartender) is great!! She is super attentive and welcoming and is always down to take a few shots with fun bar goers. 

Second, the wings are fried to perfection. If you are a wing fan, this is your joint! They have wing Mondays where the wings are 50 cents each! 

Also, you can't beat their happy hour. They have a great beer selection and are all super inexpensive. 

Moral of the story, this place is great!! Just make sure you get Alex when you go, you wont be disappointed!!!
author: kristi p.

description: First off, Alex S, don't be a 10 year old. I was there with Brian that night and service was HORRIBLE. We waited at the bar for 15-20 min without anyone acknowledging us. He was not trying to attack anyone. You going into your little tantrum and attacking him personally shows who has the insecurities. Everyone has a right to express there experience here on yelp. Thats what this site was made for. As for me, I probably wont be going back to Chug Pub anytime soon either. I do find it funny that you joined yelp the same day Brian wrote that review. VERY SUSPICIOUS!
author: Harry Y.

description:
From the looks from the outside and the area of this bar you would think its just a quite neighborhood bar. One that would have older middle aged men named Norm sitting next to his mail man friend drinking. Far from it haha. 

I've been here a few times and  each time its been a lively fun place to have a drink or 6,7,8 oh who's counting anyways :) It's a sports bar atmosphere with a pool table and a bunch of flat screens. The bartenders are funny and I must say not bad on the eyes =0 haha. There is food served there so you won't have to go some where after for that late night alki created hunger for food. Not 5 star restaurant food but good quality bar food. 

The crowd is young and fun. Multi racial though slanted (pun intended) towards the Asian side haha. Fun place to hang out any day of the week and though I've never been there for happy hour they have some great drink specials from what I can see. They even have a Chug tower (think of a tall mini keg) you can share with your friend or yourself if your that thirsty. Stop by with your friend for some fun I think you will like it.
author: mitchell l.

description: Got beers, so that alone is worth 3 stars! Plays a whole bunch of terrible music from the late 90's and don't get the house ale (blonde ale), unless you like two spoons of sugar in your draft.
author: Michael B.

description: Adding another star because I discovered its happy hour.  $3 any draft beers and well drinks until 8pm.  That's a good deal.  Plus the location is great, drink until happy hour is over, feeling a good buzz, then walk one block up the street and you can get some good food, chinese, pizza, vietnamese, etc...i'm partial to pho.  It's a great meal after drinking and it's great to eat on a nice cold night.
author: Jason Y.

description:
Lost my glasses here.  Went there for the first time last night. Great place. bought several of those towering beer columns for $30, and when it comes w/ the CURLY fries. oh man, that stuff is bomb.

Will come back, and I hope they have my glasses!
author: Morris C.

description:
This is probably my new favorite bar! I can't believe I never came here before. It's close to my house, cheap, good, strong drinks, hot ass bartender girls, and just a good crowd in general. 

Came here last night and this place was packed. But got seats right at the bar. They have so many flat t.v screens there, imagine how it would be when the Superbowl is here. They have a lot of the sports channel on and news too. They play great music and have a pool table too.

The drinks were cheaper than a lot of other bars. A shot of Henny was $8? And they do not skimp on it. The bartenders are gorgeous and sweet. Linda was super friendly and hot. If I wasn't a straight girl, I would try to hit on her! I'm definitely gonna go back again. It could even be a weekly thing!
author: Juliane N.

description:
This is the first time I have ever written a third update. I am either that good in yelp or I am that bored (meaning no life).  I think it's the latter.

I kinda influenced my friends friend to come here for his bachelor's party after Underdogs.  I like Underdogs but they seem to be lacking the  personal touch or charm..  Some of the guys wanted to go to fire fly but that place can't compare to Chug Pub.   This place has "it".  We slammed them pretty hard tonight.  I think we had around 50 heads that came in here tonight and we made everybody work.  They started using plastic cups because they couldn't wash the glasses fast enough.  Think green guys.................come on!!!! j/k.  The guy who broke the pint glass wasn't with me so please don't blame me for that.  Tim, Terrence, Sofia, and Linda did a great job..  You can always see a person's true character or true self when they are under pressure. Can they stand the heat?  are they going to crack?  They all worked really well under pressure.


If you are ever in the neighborhood...................come by here.  They are truly the nicest people you will ever meet. Haven't really tried the food though.  It smelled good.  I think Terrence and Tim do all the cooking too.  Man..........these guys do it all.  Keep it up guys!

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f3s9ervlVrM&feature=related

This video reminds me of them.
author: jason g.

description:
After passing by the Chug Pub almost every weekend and reading other Yelp reviews, I knew I had to try this place out.

This bar is like a great party - it's got something for everyone. 
Great, nice and fun bartenders who like to chat it up
a pool table (note: there is a sign up list on a chalkboard. if you're like me, you will totally miss it and cut 3 people who had their names up..oops)
cheap & strong, strong drinks
an outdoor patio!! - if you want drinks, you don't even need to go back into the bar - there's a window and the bartender can get your drink and slip it to you through the window. efficient.
flat screen tvs - great for the jocks
lots of seating 
and a parting gift!  I scored a free t-shirt here, and I didn't even need to participate in a slutty contest!
author: Vanessa W.

description: Came here for the first time. Just like any other typical bar. However, they did offer this thing called the chug? Well w/e it's called, it's not bad. It costs about $25, consisting of a huge bong like tube filled w/ Blue Moon & comes w/ a side if French fries too I believe. Overall, it's a nice chill bar. Oh, did I mention, they have a pool table as well & the bartenders are pretty cute!
author: Alex T.

description:
Probably the best spot in the surrounding area to stop in for a drink on any given night. Prices are reasonable, and the staff are quite friendly. It's nice and close to major MUNI routes (28, 71, N-Judah, 29), so it's easily accessible. They've got a handful of television screens, so there's not going to be any arguing about whether to put on the Warriors, Sharks, college football, etc. because it can all be on at once. The selection is pretty good, and there's a pool table in the back. The best time to go, in my opinion, is happy hour with a few of your friends; it's not too crowded, and drafts are only three bucks a pop. I can say the only downside is if you were to go on a Friday night and expect to be able to navigate around the bar - when it gets packed, it's PACKED, like Sardines quite truthfully.

Addendum: The bartenders are all very friendly and look quite good.
author: Sean R.

description:
Wow, I wish I had a pub like this around the corner of my street.  I'd go here every night and get drunk.  But I think that'll make me an alcoholic if I did!!  Oh wells, I'd still go here to chop it up with the locals or to shoot some pool or watch free TV.  =)

Came here with Juliane, some of her friends, and David.  What a fun night. The bartender Linda was extra cool.  Damn that Adios!  Strong but downed it like a pro.  And the YUMM on the TICTAC.  Leaves your breath smelling like fresh air!!!!

This is a fun bar to go to just to chill since clubs scenes are getting overrated... just a lil bit.
author: MaryGrace V.

description:
Not a bad place to hang out. Beer towers were kinda neat as a novelty.. not so much for value. The draft beer prices were decent enough that I saw that as a better bet, that way I can have different beers. Not talkin crappy bud light or miller draft beer but I was drinkin pints of some good ales for cheap. Place has a kitchen too.. ok.. but better than no kitchen at all. Stayed open all the way up to last call too. I'll give them props just for having food on site, who cares if it sucks, you're drunk.

Drink I recommend would be the "blue lamborghini" .. has a lot of crap in it so the 12 bucks or so is worth it. They light it on fire, need I say more?

Bartender was kind of a b*tch though for last call. The night was going so well up until the very end LOL. Oh well. Screw it. They were almost getting 4 stars but 3 seems more appropriate.
author: Ray P.

description:
One of my favorite bars to go to in the city when I just want a chill and relaxing night! The prices are affordable and they have a wide variety of drinks. The best thing is too is that if its not on the menu, just ask them to make something! The food is also really good, my top items are the fries, burger and chicken wings! What is also great is that if you don't feel like having bar food, they are more than welcome to you bringing in your own food! 

Entertainment wise, they have TVs everywhere with most likely every game that is playing that day will be there. So you can keep tabs on all your favorite teams! Don't want to just sit around and watch sports? There is a pool table, arcade games and a juke box to play your favorite music! If it doesn't have your favorite song, ask to play it off your phone real quick! The bartenders and staff at Chug Pub are super friendly and nice! So if none of those options seem enticing just hang out with the people there, everyone is so friendly, it's like Cheers! You come enough, everyone will know each others names!
author: Lorna K.

description:
Bliss: 

Leaving any Golden Gate Park event early.  
Stake out Chug Pub's Lincoln & 20th smoking patio.  
People watch your ass off as people leave the park.  
Order greasy mediocre bar food.  
Enjoy mediocre bar food.  
Make friends passing on the street.  
Make friends smoking cigs.  
Bum extra cigs from new friends.  
Insult random strangers as they walk by.  
Realize that you're wasted to the point of douchebag.  
Be okay with being a douchebag.  
Continue being a douchebag.  
Hop on your bike.  
Hop off your bike, realizing that safe riding just ain't gonna happen right now.

Just about perfect and not so busy that it gets stuffed.
author: Mat K.

description:
Damnn another great night at chug pub! Except that tequila with the worm... UGHHHHH! GROSS!!! WE WANT CHICKEN TENDERS AND FRIES! 

5 stars for Janet! 5 stars for Michelle! 5 Stars for Tim! 5 Stars for John! 5 Stars for Terence! 5 STARS FOR JEFF! hahahahahaha
author: Brian P.

description:
Stopped by to meet up with some folks after beer pong

just as Juliane N. said, "cheap, good, strong drinks, hot ass bartender girls, and just a good crowd in general". that pretty much sums it up

nice little place to meet up with friends and have a beer or shot or whatever. very cozy. our bartender was Linda, who mixes up a tasty Orange Tic-Tac and a mean AMF.
author: David D.

description:
Work bestie and I noticed Chug Pub on our way to the office a few weeks ago and decided the name was just too enticing to not stop in. So, on election night, we vowed to return to Chug Pub and do some damage as we watched the blue states roll in as Obama kicked some tail. 

Oh Chug Pub, how I love thee and thy $6 Papst and shot of Jager special! So trashy yet so clever and satisfying. They have some great beers on tap including some special holiday blends, and the food is super cheap as well (HUGE plate of nachos with the classic squirty cheese, jalapenos and salsa  for only $5!). 

As everyone on Yelp has already mentioned, the bartender was super friendly and even gave us a celebratory pint of holiday brew on the house after Obama was announced. Cheers!

Chug Pub was a cozy, friendly place  and I'll definitely be coming back with some friends for a few rounds of Jager and Papst!
author: Katie B.

description: This last visit was pretty much on a whim. When it comes to matters of the heart, don't leave your buddy at home in their pjs to drown in their sorrow on a Friday night. Nope. Tell them to get off their a**, get dressed, and put their buzz face on! Operation mind eraser started off with a cherry bomb. Next up were 2 towers of Blue Moon and two orders of fries. Homegirl even ordered buffalo wings. There was a better vibe this time around. The crowd was more diverse and the music was cool, with the exception of that one Nickelback track (grrrr). Only slight downside of the night was when the order of wings dropped. I got a crapload of sauce on my purse and on half of my left leg. Eh! It's nothing a Shout wipe and Oxyclean can't fix.
author: Rhia R.

description: I had fun when I came here.  It's a simple place with pretty cheap drinks but they are light so it's a give and take.  Nothing really stands out here or is particularly impressive.  I won't choose to come here but I won't fight it if someone I'm with wants to go.
author: Frank W.

description:
Damn, this place looks way bigger than it really is!  It's long, and narrow and can get crowded and a bit warm...even on a cold SF winter night!

My buddy had his 30th birthday bash here after dinner, and it wasn't bad.  Don't know about the drinks b/c I didn't have any, but the two bartenders ("Hired Guns" if you following Pick-up Artist on VH1), had most of my friends' attention.  Again, I don't know about their skill in making drinks b/c I didn't have any.  

The outside "patio" smoking area is smaller than the smoking area at NV!  It's about a 5 ft x 5 ft square with a couple of stools to sit and ogle at passersby.  Would be a cool place to hang out on a warm summer day in SF when there are ACTUALLY PEOPLE WALKING ALONG LINCOLN!  The cool thing is out here, there is a small window to order drinks from the bartender, and you can hear the music that you just paid $1 at the jukebox to hear!  We bought two songs, but it is impossible to even hear the tune inside the bar.

Tip 'o the day:  Parking at night is not so hard in this area.  If you don't find street parking, park in the public lot behind the KFC/Taco Bell on 20th (more towards Irving than Lincoln), and after 6 pm, you don't have to feed the meters!
author: Daniel M.

description:
A much needed sports bar in the sunset area.  Great number of TV's for your viewing pleasure.  Attracts different sorts of people, including opposing fans, so it makes for a lively crowd when the games are on.

Food there is surprisingly good.  Try the tuna melt.  Or the hamburger.  Free snacks like pretzels and popcorn.  If bar grub is not your favor, there are plenty of restaurants around the area.

Reasonably priced drinks.  They also have specials (chug tower w/ free nachos) and also specialty drinks.

Parking is not that bad.  Plenty of parking on Lincoln or Irving.  Pool table and a Street Fighter machine available.

Overall a great place to hang out with friends and have a cold one.
author: Eric W.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night and it seemed like a college-age hangout or maybe it is just on Thursdays. Pretty chill vibe, lots of TVs, jukebox, pool table, clean bathrooms (!) and very friendly, young bartenders. 

Known for the chug tower for $30, cool concept but you only get about 6 or 7 beers out of it (so my beer-chugging dude friends tell me) but with the fries or nachos that come with it for free it could be a good deal.... I kind of like the tower because it has a tap and it looks cool and I can totally imagine college kids playing beer pong and using it to fill 'er up!!
author: Christy M.

description:
2 things I'm really good at in life is drinking and eating. Chug pub has both.

First of all, the beer tower?!?! COME ON! BEST DAY OF MY LIFE!!!! 

My best friend literally lives down the street from here and we happen to just randomly walk in here to see why it was so happening.  After I saw a table with one of the towers I had to get one too.  

The other drinks are really good too so don't be afraid to order other drinks!  But a drinking sesh is never complete without some grub and their nachos and garlic fries are AWESOME! 

Also, I'm loving the pool table and juke box.  This place has it all.
author: Hanna P.

description: This is, by far, my favorite bar in the Sunset!! I started coming here back when it was the Dubliner, to later find it renamed to the Lincoln Tavern, and then again to The Chug Pub. Identity crisis, perhaps? No. New owners. But just because the owners and name changed, doesn't mean that anything else has. This bar still has nice, friendly bartenders, moderately priced drinks and it's NEVER crowded, which I'm sure has to do with the location of it (then again, I usually never come here on a weekend). It is pretty detached from the "hoppin" part of the Sunset district (ie. Irving St between 7th and 10th St.). I know some people may view the lessened amount of foot traffic through here equal to that of "lame", but to me, it is heaven. I don't believe that you should have to wait more than 5 minutes to get a drink. And I also don't believe you should have to "play for the table" (in regards to pool). Why can't we all just switch off? I go - you go - I go - you go. Here, I never have to worry about that. There is never a battle here for the table and I enjoy the people I have encountered here that are always more than willing to share. You don't find that in too many bars here in the city. The other pretty sweet thing about this place is the outdoor patio that faces Lincoln. You can step out to get a breath of fresh air and still have your beer in hand...or cigarette, whatever you prefer. If you run out of beer, there is a window you can order from, so it is unnecessary to leave the comfort of your outdoor seating arrangement. Kiosk games and a digital jukebox - bonus for me! This place is just the best and it is the one thing I miss the most about living in the Sunset. I do drop in from time to time when I can though. And the biggest bonus besides all I've just mentioned: they take credit card!! As you know, not many places in the city do, so kudos to them!! I love this place and thanks!
author: Amber Y.

description:
My work bestie and I decided to gorge ourselves in some beers and bar goodies while watching America make history. What a great place to spend Election Night! 

The bartenders are FABULOUS. She seriously rocked my world. She frantically raced around the bar attempting to adjust all the TVs to make sure we didn't feel like we were in a cave of Obama speeches--all the channels were on different feedback times, so we heard him say the same thing like 4 times about 2 seconds apart. Trust me, not good if you have ADD. Anwhoser, she raced around, fixing all the TVs so we had pure surround sound of the election coverage.

She also let us sample the beer before we ordered it and recommended the best grub to order. I got a hot link and my friend got the nachos with the "good fake cheese" as the bartender described it (obviously). 

For a neighborhood bar, in once again what I like to call the arctic tundra of SF metro (The Richmond District) Chug Pub saves the day for me. If I could only stumble home and not have to figure out the short cut through the park while driving. Sighhhhh....Guess I'll just have to drink outside on the steps and get yelled at by the crazy Russian grandmas.
author: Lexi B.

description: We decided to come here after the first bar we went to was sort of a dud. We walk in and there is a large bar with jager taps and all the drinks you could possibly think of. Then there is a room with a pool table and some areas to sit around and drink and what not. So we walk in and I get my boy a Stoplight since it's his birthday and it only came out to be $7. Super cheap, I was immediately happy about that. Good drink prices here. Next we get one of those huge dispensers of beer which holds like 3-4 liters of beer, blue moon too. We finish that pretty easy since it's a big group of people and then we get another one with fat tire and it's fairly cheap for all that beer and if you split it evenly it's a pretty good deal. So we sit and drink at the bar then we get the beer towers and walk over to the table areas and wait for the pool table to open up. The atmosphere is pretty chill with TVs everywhere playing different sport programs and some TVs with specials and menu items showcased on them. There isn't really a good mix of people at the bar, mostly dudes but it was still fun just to go out and chill. So if you want some cheap drinks, play some pool and hang out with some interesting people this is the place to be. I also came here for my 21st birthday a year or so ago but I don't recall much since I was so messed up so I had to wait for a chance where I remember things to write a review and here it is.
author: Jeromy G.

description: Went here on a Sunday night. Not super packed but there were a good amount of people there. Order the large beer thing and you get french fries or nachos included with it. The bartender was really nice and the other workers were too. A good place to grab some beer and snacks.
author: Jennie K.

description:
This place is crack'n!

This is home to the beer tower which holds about 3 liters or beer goodness! If you do order the beer tower it also comes with food! free food! Chug Pub is your local pub in the Sunset district and attracts a pretty good crowd. It is a great place to chill and drink or shoot some pool. Get there early if you want a seat because it can become quite crowded as the night progresses.

Nice, simple, tower of beer. Can't complain with that!
author: David W.

description: This is the first time I've came here since they've changed names, but everything seems to be pretty much the same.  Great neighborhood place to hang out with your friends.  Nice, friendly bartenders.  Cheap, yummy drinks.  Nice casual atmosphere.  Not too loud.  What more can you ask for!
author: Tramy V.

description: So I drive past this place almost everyday! I finally went in because I had a gift certificate...and I'm definitely going back! I ordered all kinds of food which was delicious...the calamari, burger, fries and nachos were sooo good!! Best part about this place is $3 hefenweizen from 4-8!! Only complaint is it does get a little crowded but the place is awesome!
author: nabil s.

description: I think I had fun. My empty wallet, puke on the cab and broken memory tells me I did. There looked like there were more Asians than at my family reunion, but they were all drunk like my family. Maybe it felt like home deep inside.
author: Sunie K.

description:
What?? An bar worth going to in my area? I don't believe.

Good food.
Good and Cheap drinks.
Good deals with the Beer Tower and Garlic Fries or Nachos. ($30)
Ask about it.

Great service from awesome bartenders & owner.
What more can I ask for at a local bar?
author: Jimmy N.

description: Best bar in the Sunset! Great vibe, good food, music, and the best bartenders EVER! :)
author: L F.

description:
I came here on Thanksgiving night with three of my buddies. First thing I noticed that it was a straight up cock fest in there! BUT I can't be a hypocrite because we didn't bring any of our lady friends either...

Besides that, I had a pretty good time here. The bartender (don't know his name) was very nice. I was pretty wasted and my eyes clung onto these bags of Jalapeno chips behind the counter. And of course, Mr.Bartender hooks it up with three bags. Not sure if they usually give them out...but it was a very nice gesture. 

Shots were pretty big here and were cheaper than most places. Shot of Goose was $7 and LC was $8 I believe. Better than paying $10 for some dinky little shots like at other places. 

Overall, this place was good. Nice bartenders, drinks that give you the big bang for your buck, clean...but just had a lot of dudes. Maybe all the girls were at home with their families for Thanksgiving? That's my theory and I'm sticking to it.
author: Allan M.

description:
Pretty chill bar. The crowd was pretty diverse last time I went with a small group.  It's not small (the bar and the side tables have enough room separating them for people to walk through), and they have an area for a pool table. They also have large HDTVs for your viewing pleasure. 

Of course their drinks were good, and I believe they served complimentary snacks as well. I think it was popcorns or some other chips; I don't quite remember. =)

Parking around there was decent. There's a free (for nights) public parking lot on 20th. I would come back here.
author: Sam W.

description:
The owners really value this bar, and it really shows in their hospitality and care.

They're always coming up with new drinks, and are more than happy to use you as a guinea pig.  The 3 foot beer feeder should remind you of a water feeder for a hamster, but if it doesn't, you haven't finished a foot yet.

I rarely give five stars.  Well, ok I just don't give out many five stars.  But this place I like.  So what? Wanna fight about it?
author: Alfred Y.

description: I've embarrassed myself here once. At least, I was told I did. It's a fun little place to stop in for drinks after an afternoon at the park.
author: Ana F.

description:
How the hell did this place get an average of 4.5 stars? Usually I don't expect much when I go to bars but this place was WAAAY below my standards. First of all the place is pretty cramped and hard to order drinks on a busy night since the bar area is so narrow. I'll cut them some slack here because it's hard to order drinks at most busy bars. However, I really didn't like the crowd at this place. There were a lot of ghetto AzNs that weren't too friendly. I went here with my bloods one time and we were having a hard time deciding what to drink. So I asked a girl who was sitting by herself with a drink what would she recommend. She said that she didn't drink and to ask "that" guy near the bar. Now it's quite obvious she did drink because she had one in her hand! Also "that" guy must've been her bf because when he came over he was hella glaring at me. I asked him the same question and he said "remi" and continued to glare. I swear he was going to beat me up. 

Drinks were alright here but I wouldn't come here JUST for the drinks. I really wouldn't recommend going to this place unless you hang out with ghetto AzNs. But I will say that this is a good place for a date. You can show your date that you can take a beating by a group of ghetto AzNs.
author: Michael Y.

description: A complete bar with billiards, neck-cramping TVs near the ceiling, semi-functional restrooms, and dark colored bench seating so you can't see the stains, etc.  Smells funny.  People behind the bar are nice, though.  Seems like a great place for singles.
author: Dong T.

description: always use to come here. bartenders are usually nice, the drinks are cheap, lots of tvs. good place to bring friends and play pool. can be crowded sometimes and league on mondays hog the pool table all day.
author: Jake C.

description: Awesome neighborhood bar with lots of TV's, a jukebox, bathrooms that aren't dirty, locks with two stalls, a pool table, a patio smoking area and a mixed crowd. You can totally meet new friends here since it's so narrow. If you were sitting at the bar, you can easily turn around and make conversation with the people sitting at the table since it's so close. Ate dinner on Irving? Walk down 20th to Lincoln to Chug! Full of Awesomes. :D
author: Wendy L.

description:
my buddy and i went to go hit it hard on a random tuesday night and were on our way to buckhorn, another place i have yet to visit and ran into this place instead. we went in and it was pretty cool in there.  the vibe was chill, and the beers were cheap.  they had torpedo on tap, which is a strong beer to begin with and coupled with a jamison sipper for my friend, he was well on his way to smiles.  i like how the bartenders checked his and i's id's.  im not that much over 21 but i hadnt shaved in a few days so i felt insulted when you have underage sf state students throwing up in the bathroom or walking around spilling their beers.

my buddy and i played pool and i made it even more awkward when i paid for songs on the juke box and made it apparent who ordered the songs when the typical gangster boys who arent gangster but had their parents buy their cars and still live in their 5 bedroom house walked in.  its a cool spot, just expect kids and BET gangsters.
author: JD B.

description: Good place to grab a pitcher or pint while watching a game. Food is mediocre, but hey it's a sports bar.
author: Minh V.

description:
Came here one night with some friends on a whim. I like this place better than underdogs because they have a pool table, a Marvel vs. Capcom machine, and an outdoor patio (how cool). I guess it is a relatively small bar though. The bartenders are really nice and friendly, and they take the time to come around to see if everything is okay.

We came in for the $30 beer tower + nachos. The beer was alright (they all taste the same to me, just different levels of bitterness). The nachos were pretty good though. They didn't skimp on the cheese or salsa. 

On a separate occasion I came here for garlic fries, which smelled and tasted great but I wouldn't call them garlic fries. But I have to say it was a really big portion and decently priced.
author: Jay L.

description:
I like beer.  Chug Pub has beer... so I am a fan.

...

really though, it's a great place to get a beer and hang with friends.  Feel like making it a long night?  Get the chug tower.  The selling point for me was the free nachos! woohoo!  There's also a good selection of beer on tap.

I like the fact that this bar has a menu, which also has descriptions of different kinds of beer on the back.  The menu is pretty big too, with food and alcohol filling it up.  The bartenders are always super friendly.  There's a pool table and smoking area.  Pretty cool spot compared to most of the places around the area.

Who wants to share a chug tower?!
author: Chris C.

description: Best place to be for St. Patrick's Day... Green beer flows...
author: Sheree A.

description: Well rum i've never seen (and that's saying something), a great smoking section and friendly and attractive wait staff.  definitely a stop for anyone in Golden Gate park who needs refreshment.
author: C. Grant M.

description: Decent prices. Decent bartenders. Love the location. Good neighborhood bar that has food.
author: Sylvia V.

description:
Clean bathrooms, clean bar, clean tables, clean seats... am i in sf?! The service, food, and drinks were all much better than I had expected from this corner pub and I'm definitely glad we went here to bask in drunken glory when CAL beat STANFORD and got the axe back ('08, baby!) Although the bf and I were amongst the younger of the customers, it was a lot better than other 'sports bar's' I have been to. 

The bartenders were very accommodating as they turned the game on two screens and adjusted the volume and occasionally made sure we were ok... do you want another drink, do you want something to drink, more pretzels, etc. She also tried to disrupt the old creepy guy from trying to talk to me (as the boyfriend went to the bathroom) by asking me if I needed help. She's awesome! Overall, a very pleasant experience. As a girl, I think I enjoyed the clean floors of the clean bathroom with fully stocked paper towels and soap that dispenses. LOVELY.
author: Joyce D.

description:
Love this place.  Very friendly and chill place.

I have been here so many times, and each time, i enjoyed myself.  I usually come here to hang out with friends.  On our rowdy days, we drink a lot and are very loud. On our chill days, we just sit n chat amongst ourselves.  But whether loud or quiet, we always feel welcomed here.  

LOVE LOVE LOVE the selection of beers on tap.  15 different beers on tap.  THIS is what I call a bar.  

The bartenders here are extremely nice.  

And oh the snacks are perfect!!!  The wings they have here are so good!!! They have fries, popcorn, calamari, chicken wings.  All perfect bar food.  

Can't go wrong with a bar like this.
author: Mai H.

description: Beer tower for $30. Any beer? I'm in. Free nachos? yeaa. Had my first snake bite here and it reminded me of an Asian sugar plum drink in sparkling water with a bad after taste... I'm not a big beer drinker, so I should not be reviewing beer. The guava mojito was yummm! I highly recomend the mojito. Next one up was the Flaming Dr. Pepper which could get dangerous fast since it tastes like Dr. Pepper! Don't forget to blow out the flame before you drop the hard liquor in the cup of beer. The bartender made a shot that consisted of 6 hard liquor and set it on flames called the "ghostrider". Could barely taste the alcohol going down with the heat burning. Curly fries were fresh and so good, we ordered two!!!
author: Anne T.

description:
Nice looking sports bar with its basic amenities for one.  They've several TVs along with a big screen, a pool table and a smoking area of all you smokers out there. 
Their signature item is the chug tower which consists of a three foot tall tower with your choice of beer.  That with nachos is $30.  Not bad of a price especially if you got a group of friends to split the money for it.  
For the most part its a good vibe, friendly bartenders, and a great place to watch a ballgame.
Now let's get the chug tower!!!!
author: Kris A.

description: My favorite Sunset bar by far!  Great local bar wilth awesome crowd.  the staff is super friendly.  Multiple TV screens to keep up with the sports updates.  Reasonably priced drinks and bar food.  Try them out as you won't be disappointed.
author: Patrick C.

description: Ok, this place may have a different clientele than what I know of. But, I tend to like bars with more diversity. This was a local watering hole in the Sunset I chose. It's definitely has that local on campus bar feel to it. It's close to USF, City Coll. and State. There were a lot of young people here. By young I mean 21-25 age range. This place has a predominantly Asian patronage. But it's plenty loud and boisterous over here. The drinks aren't priced sky high [good, good], considering what I drink is always top shelf shit. They have a very friendly staff of bussers, and bartenders. They also serve food, nothing really exotic or of great variety. Burgers, fries, fried finger foods... I actually didn't eat or see the menu. I saw what was coming out of the swinging kitchen doors. There is a pool table, enclosed smoking area, and coin operated juke box. I'd go back with a crew of friends. Had a good time @ the Chug.
author: Erik R.

description:
Very chill place to be on a tuesday night....or any night for that matter.

Owner's and managers are always willing to say whats up and chill with you.
author: Dan N.

description:
the nicest bartenders in the area!
i've been here three or four times, and the people remmeber me. The bathrooms are super clean too.
author: Tasos P.

description:
Man, Chug Pub is THEE place to be!

- Bartenders (esp. Sophia) are super friendly!
- Friendly crowd.
- Free pool on Sundays.
- Good food! Bomb-ass cheeseburgers and fries!

I can just say, I never leave this place sober! Thanks Sophia...
author: Matt W.

description: I'm not really into the chug pub, I went there once before for St. Patrick's Day and realized it just isn't my scene. The beer tower was cool except that it is mostly foam when you start getting to the middle/bottom. But they did take the time to create the illusion that there's still more beer in it. The place and the atmosphere just isn't anything special. Sure, it's fairly nice and there's plenty of pool tables with lots of people my age, but It just doesn't come across as anything different to me from many other bars. Last weekend my friends and were hanging out in their outside patio the whole time which was a lot of fun. It made for a different experience which was cool. I still don't plan on going back.... but if I did, I would be kicking it out on that patio with friends ordering drinks through the window ;)
author: Katie S.

description: This is a great option for a weeknight. The drinks are cheap, they have food, a smoking area, and a pool table. People are cool and the bartenders are awesome!
author: Megan F.

description: Pleasantly unremarkable. Nothing special, worth a stop if your in the area or a local. There are better bars in the city though. The game machine was busted and the bartender didn't care which was kinda bunk. The city has so many places to drink i dont know that i'll be returning unless it's for a beer tower.
author: Corvus C.

description:
A 3 foot tower filled to the brim with your favorite beer and a basket full of chips topped with cheese from a can could be all yours for only 30.00!  This is the essence of chug pub, great value and tons of fun. 
 
The crowd is always eclectic and chill.  Want to be anti social? It's hard to ignore the multitude of televisions, the pool table, or the table top bar game (photo hunt is my favorite).  Chug Pub is an easy decision either on a Saturday night or lazy Sunday afternoon.  

Bonus: How can I forget that there is always a friendly and attractive female behind the bar.
author: Jordan T.

description: Cool neighborhood bar.  Staff is nice and drink specials are good.  Best when not overflowing with people.
author: Matt L.

description:
I'd been here back in the day of Dubliner but never before have I had such a good time and met as many cool & friendly people as I did last weekend at the now named Chug Pub (different management then Dubs). I had a great night with a good mix of people. Everyone there drinking and the entire staff were great. Good bar pooltable and some decent competition (sorry guys and gal, I had to gloat ;). It was one of the best "first time visits to a pub/bar" I ever experienced. Plus, it was their one year anniversary and they had platters of free Thai food... a great filler to keep you on the drink and feeling good. I was just going there for a couple drinks but stayed till they kicked us out at closing. 

Bonus for clean and large bathrooms and smoking area...

Shout out to Tim, Justin and crew who made it a great night! And to the bartenders who I never caught your names, but thanks for being so friendly, attentive and fast with orders.  Best to you all and see you soon for sure. 

I will have to return for the NFL ticket and try the food... until then, I will keep with 4 stars but I am shooting for 5.
author: Eric R.

description: Just moved to the neighborhood and went there on sunday to watch some football.  $10 burger & beer not bad. Not to crowded, i could actually watch and listen to the Raiders win! Definitely will be headed back for more.
author: Benji S.

description:
I have raised Chug Pub up a star due to the fact the the owner made an effort to contact me and ask what I thought he needed to do to make his Whisky selection more attractive to me. Most of the people we write about just shrug of reviews and move on. SO Kudos to the Chug Pub!!!!!!! 

This is a cool place to hang out with some friends on a week night if you are in the area. I like this place a lot now that I have been there a few times. Nice people who work here and good prices on the booze. 

I wish they had a better selection of Whisky since that is my thing. They have all the major labels but nothing special to offer from independent bottlers. The prices on the Whisky they offer are very fare and the prices on the beers are good as well. 

They have a pool table but so many people waiting to get on and play it isn't worth putting your name on the list if you are only going to be there for an hour or two. 

They have a heated smoking room that my friends and I tend to hang out in since we all smoke and the great thing about this is they have a window linked to the bar so you don't have to go back in to order. 

Over all this is a cool place and it is nice to see a younger generation taking over the older bars and bringing new life to them. I have not yet tried the food but it seems they have a good menu of bar food so I will get there one night early to try and claim a space at the bar or one of the few tables inside to try it out.
author: don h.

description:
First off, lost my Yelp review virginity to Chug Pub...she's that good.
Chug pub is an amazing bar/pub that I have frequented many a time with my buddies during happy hour and long into the night. I live in the outer Sunset, pretty much 20 blocks down, and this is one of the best bars in the area. Beer prices are normal, with $2 dollar Tuesdays with Red Ale (pretty decent ale, maybe a 6% ABV?). I like to drink...and drink a lot...and chug pub gets my fuel tank filled. 
Outdoor smoking spot is really awesome. Its heated and has music. Its fun when you are hammered and spit out on the sidewalk or flick a smoke through the opened area and almost nail some passerby. I don't care, its all good in my book.
Great for a group of people or with a pal during happy hour. Bank of America and other banks are only a block away on Irving-so if you don't want to drop extra drinking cash on the ATM, you know where to go.
So yea, drink and be merry, for tomorrow we may die!
edit:  the bartenders are babes.
author: Zach L.

description: Okay, if you want to grab a beer and be outside/inside.  What makes it for me is the nice people who work here.  Just a local hole that gets props for good service.
author: Valerie B.

description: Hella crackin on a Saturday night. Not a bad place to have a drink or two, then continue your night on, or you can stay here the whole time, as long as you have a sweet spot near the pool tables or a seat in general! It's your average bar with a cute little name, however, there is one thing that sets this part a place from others, the mo-effin french fries are the shit!!!
