Perfectly fried to a nice crisp, seasoned beautifully, ok, a tad on the salty side but for some bar food, they were damn good french fries. I will only return for the fried fare.
author: Tatiana D.

description: I pass by this bar everyday and decided yesterday was the day to try it out. As far as pub food goes it's good. I mean not mind blowing stuff but just the right amount of greasiness that I was anticipating. My buddy and I both got the chicken tenders and fries. Usually chicken tenders are super dry in the middle. Not these. Moist crunchy deep fried goodness. My hips probably hate me. And they have my fav Blue Moon. I actually don't remember how much we paid for the beer. Well, who does after a few cold ones anyway.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
ok after tonight I feel I needed to make a review about this place. first of all I just wanna say this place is great....drinks are proper and snacks are fucking awesome. employees are all helpful and friendly.

tonight I saw the most ridiculous thing I have ever seen happen at a bar. so at 2 am people need to be out of a bar. as everyone is getting kicked out this dude decides that he doesn't wanna leave and actually gets in one of the workers  face. he actually bumped into the guy and was all up in his face.if it was me I would knocked this asshole out. this motherfucking dip shit had the nerve to actually be mad that he's getting kicked out. yelling fuck you as he walked away. the funny thing is the dip shit and his girl lived across the street. this dumb bitch actually opened her window and started yelling "yelp.com....yelp.com" so I felt the urge to put a review in there defense. its 2am you stupid fucks they have to kick you out!
author: Leo M.

description: Woohoo! Our little watering hole. Never gets too crowded. Always has the best service. Happy Hour til 8!
author: Ping N.

description:
i came here for garlic fries. yeahyeah a bar drinking blahblah. i don't drink. so! garlic fries! i asked bartender dude "do you have garlic fries?" - "yeah" "ok ill take 2 orders to go please" he goes in the kitchen area pulls out the fries from the freezer fries them up and puts salt and some green stuff on it. "here you go, 6.50" "thanks".
off i go thinking o boy! theres so much! woo hooo! i'm going to have the stinkiest breath ever!
i open them.... wtf theres no garlic....... 
my friend said it was more like sour cream and onion fries. they were good fries i guess... but NO GARLIC.
DANGIT
author: just k.

description: Great happy hour and decent price on a chug tower plus a pool table. That's all I need. Never had a bad experience with any of the staff even when it gets super crowded, which it does. Irish pub atmosphere and plenty of TVs to watch games and what not. Definitely my go to place when I'm in the Sunset.
author: David G.

description:
anytime fun.

this is a totally biased review on my local watering hole that took me in when i arrived in San Francisco and offered me tasty drinks, late-night munchies, good music with impromptu sing-a-longs, fast friends, friendly regulars, awesome bartenders, a place to hang out every Thursday as well as on the occasional Tuesday and Sunday or any day of the week for that matter. 

the end.
author: zain i.

description:
Helllll yeah! 

I love chug pub!
author: Jen K.

description:
lots of beer, beer tower, pool table, great crowd, funny bartenders.

this place is where i go to get sloshed before going out, or just to watch the games with some friends.

their food menu aint bad either... but youre mostly here for the fun atmosphere.
author: Dennis C.

description: Yes, a good bar. Very reasonable prices, friendly and fast service (even on a crowded Saturday night), and great selection of beer and some hard to find liquors. The highlight for me, however, was the food. Now, of course a fresh grilled cheeseburger tastes amazing in a bar at 1 AM. This is why I decided to go back for a quick (and sober) lunch. To my delight, the food was even better when I could taste it! Not the place for a healthy sophisticated dining experience, but for a big juicy cheeseburger that tastes like I just BBQ'ed it myself: you can find me at Chug Pub.
author: Jon J.

description: Chugpub is the spot for folks that live off of 19th ave! Me, my roommates, and friends have been coming here for over a year thanks to the the 28 and Owl bus lines. The bartenders and management are great and friendly, and the great drink specials make sure I come back to hang. Who would have guessed that a beer tower and fries were a perfect combination.
author: Ignacio L.

description: Can you make a good thing better? Hell yes! I'm not a huge burger fan, but I had the burger the other night and it might have been one of the best burger's I've ever had. I really really loved it. It had some kind of spicy sauce on it, which I can't really explain, but it was amazing.
author: Brandon B.

description: Great place to hang out on a weekend! I really liked the atmosphere of the place and especially enjoyed the chug tower, which is a $30 tower of beer (approx. good for 3-4 peeps).  Also comes with choice of appetizer.  I went on a pretty busy night but was still able to get my drinks relatively quick.  There are a lot of T.Vs in the bar area and even has a pool table off to the side.  This is a great bar to hang out in and would recommend checking it out.
author: Foodie G.

description: This place is growing on me.  I find myself here more and more for weeknight drink.  Maybe because I had this strange tendency of liking places with cool smoking rooms.  I actually come here and take over their smoking room, and turn it into my lounge with my friends.  Bartenders are nice, and the owners are really cool peeps.  The fries are great!
author: Jenny K.

description:
i really want to go back and try that beer feeder!!!!!!!

this place was fine. it was a friday night and there were only like 3 groups of people in there. not too crowded. however i have seen it get crowded in the past.

good gin and tonic. nice staff. clean. its just your usual bar.

maybe ill write something better when i try the beer. as for its just...like whatever.
author: A. V.

description: nice place with a good mix of customers. Drinks are reasonably priced and there is a juke box and pool table. Aside from the fact that the bar tender didn't know how to make the drinks I wanted to order, this is a pretty cool place with super good nachos! yea, definitely go and try the nachos.
author: meL Z.

description: The bartenders are cute (Linda, Michelle, Sophia! Hi girls!), drinks are cheap, and it's just a great hangout spot for the person/s trying to let off some steam because of a rough week. Generally NOT packed with girls, but thats ok thats why the bartenders are there. Go get a basket of curly fries, a chug tower, and you are set. Go check it out for yourself. Remember its CHUG-PUB spelled with a very big F...U... oh yeah and a N
author: Jon L.

description: nice neighborhood bar. drinks are super cheap. they have pretty good eats...my friends ordered nachos and they looked pretty bomb. nice chill place to grab a drink with friends. its a bit of a high school reunion though...we ran into a lot of folks we went to school with. i'm not really surprised given the location but sometimes you just don't want to be forced to make small talk with people that you probably aren't going to be hanging out with anytime soon. =P
author: Linda N.

description:
This place is great: relaxed vibe, awesome bartender and great drinks... what more can you ask for!? 
The best part was the bartenders, who were really personable.  A free round for our group didn't hurt anything either.  Ask the bartender for a Red Carpet Deluxe (his specialty), your lady friend will love it.
author: Nikkers B.

description: A good place to drink some good local craft beers and eat french fries. The drinks are decent priced. Usually they get really crowded during the weekends so I would like to come during week days better. The staff are pretty nice.
author: Mike S.

description: Great place. Awesome design and name. Spacious = not too stuffy. I don't usually go to bars much, but I really like this neighborhood bar because it's clean. The floors if spilled on, are cleaned up instead of walking around on stickiness. The bartenders were also really fast and I was pretty impressed. Keep it up Chug Pub!
author: Katherine F.

description: The Chug Pub is a cool place to grab a beer with your friends and relax.  They always have a game on and some kind of drink special.  I wouldn't come here if you're looking for a wild night.  Its just a quiet pub but the food is good and the people here are friendly and relaxed. You can probably find me on one of the stools here a couple nights a week.
author: Michael S.

description: 1 year later and i still love this place!  it's definitely become my pub- i've made some great friends there and the bartenders and staff are amazing.  this place makes me wanna smile.  yay for janet, sonia, john, david, and of course terence!  the friendliest neighborhood bar you'll find.
author: Jen V.

description: I love this place. They  have an open air room with a fan, heat lamps, and a little window to the bar for smokers. You can smoke a cigarette, stay warm, dry, AND still get booze. When you're done smoking, you can head inside and get a game to play with your friends, or wait in line to play some drunken rock band on the bar's PS2. Drunken rock band is the best rock band.
author: Jason H.

description: I've seen this place a few times and dropped in once to look for a friend. But, yesterday I actually went in for a drink for my first time. Overall atmosphere was okay, bigger pub than the usual bars I go to, but parking was difficult unless you park on Irving. I am very picky when it comes to service because that's why we tip right? I was very dissatisfied when the bartender asked me for my ID and I had to pull it out of my wallet. She didn't even look at my age and gave my ID back. Then I put it back in my wallet and then she tells me she forgot to look at my age. I know I am being anal and maybe she was drunk, but that irritated me to pull my ID back out from my wallet because I rarely get carded wherever I go. On the bright side, they do have snacks and warm appetizers that help with the drinking.
author: Pudgy G.

description: Great bar to hang out at with a great group of friends!  Conveniently located near my house so I can just walk there! Shoot some pool and enjoy the beer tower!
author: Priscilla L.

description: I like the Chug Pub for a great place to hang out shoot pool, drink beer, and burn. Its perfect for hanging out with a few friends. They have a great smoking cubby that opens up to the park side. The ratio was about 50/50 boys to girls. Everyone was cool, and John, the bartender was really friendly and attentive.
author: Philip N.

description: For months I went by this place every day on the bus. I always thought I would never go to a place called the Chug Pub, I had visions of my nasty college bar.  At last I broke down and my roommate and I headed on over. Besides the fact that my bartender told me I didn't look nearly as old as I really was (I'm 29 she was barely 21) the place was great. Affordable, a good beer selection. Pitchers. Decent pub food. They have a 3 liter beer thing (which really is 2.5 liters).  Good place to just go grab a beer and watch a soccer match.
author: Jessica S.

description: Came here to watch Game 4 of the Lakers/Magic game with a buddy of mine and it was a great time.  Got there a little early so got a chance to chat up the bartender and little and pick a good seat to watch all the action from.   The bartender was very attentive and was easy on the eyes as well.  They had at least 10-12 beers on tap though i stuck with the trusty blue moon for most of the night.  Happy hour lasted until 8 pm so i got most of my drinking in before the cut-off.  The food isn't amazing per se but its typical bar food so what do you expect?  The crowd was great though most were in to watch the game but it was cool to chat with some of them.  Definitely a place i would go to again.
author: Chris C.

description: Came here on New Years Eve and it was packed! Could barely find a stool in site! The bartenders were all ladies and all pretty hot. The space had the right vibe to it and I saw a couple of the gigantic chug towers being ordered. Overall, I liked their drinks and I can see that they were definitely pouring generously. That Tokyo Tea may look good, but it will FU*K you up!! I saw the bartender with two bottles at her hand as she poured, poured and poured some more! Then a little bit of this, and back to pouring again with her two bottles! Tasted nasty, looked good. Everything else was good though. The curly fries are delicious, but the regular ones are plain and seems to be unsalted. Prices are very good. The place is small, but great.
author: Elaine H.

description: Ha stopped by here friday night and it was packed.  The guys here must be doing something right.  I finally saw the chug tower that I hear so much about....crazy.  Also I still can't get over how cheap drinking at a bar is compared to club prices.  Great place to hang out with friends and have fun.
author: Allison T.

description: I spent 2008 NYE here and 2008 Halloween here.  Its two blocks from my place so it makes sense.  Plus the guy bartenders are hot.
author: Fatty A.

description:
great bar off of 19th ave. they have a pool table, and have a indoor smoke lounge or should i say an outdoor smoke lounge with heaters. great place to hang out on a friday night. been there one time and would like to go back. 

parking- sucks of course but, you could get lucky
prices- i believe they have drink specials.
food- there are appetizers
author: master b.

description: Well, if I gave Dragon Lounge a 4, this place can't get anything lower. In fact, I'd go a little higher just because they have food. Just another local bar in sunset, great place to hang out. and plus, can't go wrong with a bar that serves Hendricks
author: Jin S.

description: Was here on a Friday night for a friends birthday.  The place was great, scene was cool (half the crowd was our friends that came out to celebrate).  There was one HUGE thing that totally ruined the night.  The bouncer with his slick back hair and pink dress shirt, that exposed a pale chest.  Really?  Anyways, the beef with him is that he totally disregarded that the place was packed for a birthday party, I was somewhat in the back of the bar area, snapping pictures of the birthday boy blowing out his candles, and he starts to push my girlfriends, huffing and puffing, "you guys can't be here, what do you think this is, ramble ramble ramble, then what blew it out of the water, he says "Who the F are these kids".  LOL.  Okay guy, if we weren't there the only people that would be there, don't even look old enough to party.   I'm gonna forever swear against this place.  Totally unaccomadating, rude and disrespectfull.  Don't bite the hand that feeds you...
author: Alice E.

description: Great place for a drink or ten.  Cute bartenders are always a plus and reasonably priced drinks.  Plus, despite being so close to Irving & 19th Ave, parking isn't nearly as bad as I would have imagined.  This is definitely going to be one of my 'usual' bars now.
author: Allan H.

description: Will definitely go back. They have an awesome tower of beer and you can get anything on tap. We got about 9 pints out of it for $30 and we also got fries. This place was comfortable and fun for me and friends to go out and get drinks. The tower is a perfect gift to someone on their 21st birthday.
author: Asia S.

description: oh Chug Pub how I love you! The owners and bar manager are the nicest, most fun guys to hang out with! It's a clean bar with clean bathrooms! Their bartenders are all so cute and friendly, and they make mean drinks! I love the chicken wings there and the fries are damn good. The crowd here is always friendly they come in flocks pretty late like 11p..and I event get $2 Tiger Beer specials on certain nights!
author: Dessa R.

description: chug pub is a chill spot to hangout with friends. the service is quick and the drinks are cheap! they also serve up some wings and fries that are tasty.
author: Gordon F.

description: Good place to hang out with friends. Not too loud or rowdy, fun atmosphere. Bartenders are nice and attentive, food is good (nothing like skinny fries to satiate your drunken appetite) and prices aren't bad.
author: Jasmine O.

description: We stumbled in here after a free concert at Golden Gate Park.  What a great little find.  Very nice staff.  Of course my friend and I were complaining a little too loudly that it was hot in there and someone who works there came right over and told us he just put the ac on for us.  We ordered the Chug Tower and were surprised with our free nachos.  That was awesome!  Oh, and the juke box had a great selection of songs!  Overall, a pretty fun place that I will be coming back to when in the area.
author: Kim C.

description: This place is very nice.  Very Chill bar with a good mix of people.  Bartenders are nice.  And cannot complain about a place that serves Hendricks and curly fries
author: Kendrick D.

description: This bar is drop dead goodness. It's got all the features a true drinker needs. One of two places I know that serves Tiger beer. Fish & Chips is a huge plus. Great environment and atmoshphere. I especially like the location and hours of operation; open pretty early. Service is always good. The staff is young and energetic. See for yourself.
author: Butch M.

description: Have been frequenting this location for many years through its various incarnations, but as the chug pub it has never been better. Very friendly bartenders and owners. Terence is always up for a chat and makes everyone feel welcome. Try the chicken wings and the onion rings!
author: ODHRAN M.

description:
Fried food, pool, flat screen TVs everywhere (all sports, 24/7), awesome bartenders (that'll remember your name), 3 foot tall chug towers, and an outdoor patio area in which to drink and smoke.... which includes a little sliding door that the bartender can slip a drink through... awesome.

My favorite spot to chill and catch up on my Sports Center.  I would say that they should re-name this place "Cheers,"  if that name wasn't already taken.  I guess "Chug Pub" works too.
author: Vincent M.

description: This place is dope!! You really can't ask for anything more then what these guys provide! Friendly ass service, good ass drinks killer POOL table and sports. Why would you go anywhere else in the sunset!! CHUG PUBS the best!!! Kudos to Tim and his staff for making me feel welcomed!!
author: Joely L.

description:
TVs on every pillar recapping the top ten, NICE bartenders, and a wide selection of beer.  Thursday, Friday, and Saturday are busy.  I've only had the hot popcorn, but I hear the food is commendable.

Three of us went here for a couple.  Unfortunately, it was Smirnoff's promotional night...,so we had to celebrate.  Hey, it was free, I live in the area, and it was free.  With the economy so tough...j/k not gonna go down that route.  But seriously, see for yourself.
author: leak l.

description:
I've been to the Chug Pub a few times and I've loved it every time.  I was iffy/tickled by the name of the place, but I gave it a chance anyway and I'm glad I did.  The size of the place is about right and I've yet to see it get too crowded.
Most of the time I've just had a few pints, but my recent trip I started with some of the food, the chicken strips and fries, which was good and just right for the price.
That same trip me and my buds decided it was time for the Chug Tower!  The tower is awesome.  It's not exactly going to save you a lot of money, but it's enjoyable to have your refills sitting next to you wherever you are, and some Nachos to go with it, for about the right price.  I recommend it just for the adventure.
Most importantly, I give this place major credit for the small "inside-yet-outside" area for smokers.  Being able to have my drink and smoke a cigg is something I have not been able to do for a long time.
Props to you Chug Pub.
author: Caleb G.

description:
Best bar in town for several reasons:

1) Good prices
2) Great drinks
3) Hella beers on tap
4) Tasty munchies
5) Cool mixed crowd
6) Friendly owners
7) Hot bartenders
8) CLEAN BATHROOMS!!!

I've been to this bar several times and I've never left unhappy or SOBER for that matter. My friends and I love the chug towers! This place is definitely a favorite!
author: Bob S.

description: A great bar to hang out with friends... we came here after a long day at CAS and de Young since it was close by  to grab a few drinks... we left the bar completely hammered... lol.  We started off with the Chug Tower which is a GREAT deal... The chug tower is $30 dollars and it comes with fries and nachos (I think, I'm not sure, there was a little confusion at first but we ended up with fries and mozerella sticks because they didn't have nachos)  The chug tower pours about 8 pint glasses full of beer... and they have a great selection of beer... Where else can you get such a great deal?  After the beer we started drinking their special shots... the bartenders were super friendly and started making us their "specialty" shots which lead us to be in a very drunken state... but the shots were very tasty and different!  There's a pool table and tons of TVs to watch sports and other things on... there is also a smoking room which is completely ventilated to the outside but nice if you want to smoke and not outside in the rain.
author: Kymberli C.

description: Parked near this bar several nights ago to have dinner on Irving. It seemed lively and was fairly crowded for a tues night so my friends & I decided to check this place out. It was a surprise as I expected a quiet bar . It was a very comfortable space to hang with friends.and everyone there was  friendly. All the customers seemed to be enjoying themselves with the games etc. the space feels like a giant family room! Nice addition to the neighborhood. Will be going there again.
author: M H.

description: So a friend and I were looking for a place to chill on a Monday night that had a good vib where we could just sit and have drinks...we saw all the reviews on yelp and bang zoom, here I am. Thank the fucking lord. This place is AMAZING. It's in a pretty easy location to get to and the whole place is SO clean. I mean you could eat off the floor. I wouldn't god-forbid I mean seriously ewww, but the point is you COULD. They were playing Scurbs on TV, and seriously who doesn't love Scrubs? The drinks were strong as the river Styx and the bartender was so fun. Seriously she was a doll. I want to invite that bitch on my next girls night out I love her to death. Even after sitting there a few hours and just chilling she made us up shots at the end of the night, just cuz. Too adorable. Great vib, great bartenders, and even with a jukebox that eats your money (they gave it back to us) this place is a 10!
author: Marissa S.

description:
i love this place!  everytime i come back to the bay area and meet up with my friends, i want to find an easy place to get a drink at a good price.  i came here on a friday noon, and found the place fairly crowded, but was still easy to talk to my friends and order drinks.  their appetizers are pretty good too.

this is my new venue for prepartying and lounging with friends.  it might be a bit far from the SF action, but its worth it.  i cant stand being in the middle of the city unable to find parking and getting ripped off for a beer.
author: D C.

description: This place will forever be known as the "blackout spot."  All in good context, of course!  Thanks, Tim, Terrance, and Janet.  The people are good, the drinks are good, the food is doable, and the beer towers keep everyone happy.  Don't forget to pick up your Chug Pub T-shirt from behind the bar.  It's an American Apparel tee and is actually extremely cute!
author: Kendra R.

description: Came here a couple weeks ago and ordered a couple of towers ($30 regardless of beer choice). Nice selection of beers and can't beat the nachos or fries with each tower! The chicken tenders were also good. It wasnt that crowded when we went, so it was a great place to hang out with a group and drink.
author: Lauren K.

description: I love breaking awkward conversations with people by challenging them to a drunken game of jenga.  Good times!  Chug Pub, by far, is my favorite bar in the Sunset District.
author: Alice T.

description: Definitely the best in the Sunset! The crew is great. Big UPS to Terrance and the girls for holding it down. Can't go wrong with a tower (includes grub) when you're chillin with some friends.
author: Glen S.

description: CLEAN bathrooms, tasty food, friendly and attentive bartenders, great crowd! Love this place!
author: A W.
